loans.name: 0302011-Tây Hải -Hoằng Thanh - Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lợi works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle that she plans to raise in order to sell in the future.

Lợi is 59 years old and married with 3 children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 0302011 Tây Hải Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. In 2007, Lợi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lợi has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lợi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Lợi hopes that her business will do well and make enough money. With the profit from her business, she hopes to remodel her house and provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Antokia Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is in her late 40s, is married with two children who go to school. She has been running poultry and catering businesses since 1998.  She works from 6 a.m. to 12 midnight (including catering services time) and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy chicken feed and more catering utensils. Her dream is to one day be able to buy an incubator for producing chicks to sell and to increase her stock in her poultry business.

She will share this loan with her loan group 'Antokia', which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and catering utensils.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a resident of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is 34 years old, married and is taking good care of her four school-aged dependents.

Marivic owns and operates a specialized retail store selling spices, fruits and vegetable varieties in the local community. The family generates income from other less permanent means, but the main source of income is derived from the selling activity. For the past 6 years, Marivic has been able to achieve a total income of 28,000 PHP each month from this job and with alternative sources.

Marivic has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This is her 10th borrowing cycle made in GDMPC since her registration in 2008.

Marivic hopes to sustain, improve and expand her business engagement in the future and lay aside some portion of earnings to cover educational expenses of the children.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Muliki

texts.en: Muliki is a 44-year-old married woman with 7 children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Muliki has been selling cassava flour for 20 years in which she acquired capital from farming. Her hardship is price fluctuations and her vision is having her own food store for cassava flour plus an educated family. Muliki needs the loan facility to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour and pay school fees

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 32 years old. She is married and is rearing her six school-aged children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

To earn a living, Liza operates a transportation business - pedicab in particular. It is a vehicle, somewhat like a bicycle, capable of carrying a maximum of 7 persons, but only a short distance. She has been operating this kind of service for over 5 years, allowing her to receive a total monthly income of 9,400 PHP, taking into consideration other irregular sources of income. Liza has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

Liza is hopeful to sustain business deals and day-to-day needs of the family. She plans to save some portion of her income for her children's education.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a resident of Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 42 years old and a single mom of one school-aged child. 

Marivic operates a small food stall in her hometown for subsistence. She sells mostly snack items like checheria and candies, and some cigarettes and crispy sliced mangoes. She has been selling these goods for over ten years. She usually gets her daily expenses met from the business profits. At the end of each month, she is able to get 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). 

Marivic has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy additional snack items to sell. This is her first time borrowing from the cooperative and she hopes to borrow some more in the future. 

Marivic plans to expand and improve the business to gain more income and prepare for the education of her child.

loans.use: To buy additional snack items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 37-year-old single mother of one child, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Currently, she operates a boutique which she has owned for 7 years. Her major challenge has been untimely settlement of debts. Pamela needs the loan to buy shirts, trousers, and women's wear for sale. Her dream is to set up a nursery school one day.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, and women's wear for sale.

loans.name: Marylo

texts.en:
Marylo is 48 years of age and married. She lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, together with her three children.

Marylo owns and operates a motorcycle transport business for a living. Her spouse is working abroad, trying to give a better life and education to his children. But the everyday needs of the family are taken from the vehicle's income. 

She has been engaged in this activity for three years and earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase vehicle tires and other spare parts in order to pursue business operations immediately.

Marylo has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. This is the second loan request made by Marylo in the cooperative. 

Marylo is hoping to retain this business engagement for long, long years and expand its seating capacity to earn a greater income.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: 030410-Liên Hà -Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hòe works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to raise and sell. She is 44 years old and married with three children. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. Hòe has been involved in her business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. In 2008, Hòe joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hòe has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hòe hopes to buy more land, to remodel her house, and to make enough money to provide for her kids. Mrs Hòe is the leader of a four member group: the 030410 Liên Hà Hoằng Thanh Solidarity Group.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-five-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the textile business for ten years. He got the initial capital from his previous employment, started a retail shop, and later transformed it into a textiles shop. His hardship comes from debtors who take long to pay. His vision is to grow into a large-scale textiles shop and to have a poverty-free educated family. Joseph needs the loan facility to buy textiles for sale.

loans.use: to buy textiles for sale

loans.name: Evan Nicolas

texts.en:
Evan Nicolas is a 54-year-old man. He is married with two grown children. The family settled in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Evan Nicolas owns and operates a motorcycle transport business for a living. He has been running a route around routine destinations for over five years. His wife works abroad to provide for better living conditions for their family. Evan Nicolas depends mainly on his transport business income to buy everyday household necessities. This transporting job allows him to earn PHP 5,000 each month. He has borrowed PHP 22,000 from GDMPC to purchase vehicle spare parts and resume his quality business.

Evan Nicolas became a GDMPC member earlier this year. In the future, Evan Nicolas hopes to expand seating capacity and improve further the services offered to attract more passengers. He expect another loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with two children who go to school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. Lucy's house has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water for her family. 

She has operated a green-grocery business for the past three years. Her clients are her neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu to gain easy access to loans when she needs help.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a lady married to a businessman; they have no children yet. She runs a clothing sales business at Tena estate in Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years now. She says the business is profitable and the only challenge she has is financial constraints and harassment from the local government. However, she works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure her business is doing well. 

She is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy stock of inner wear to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Faridah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with twp children who go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week .She has been in business for the last four years. Farida has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. Her major challenge includes transportation and electricity. Her goal is to educate her children to the university level and to start importing second hand clothes. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water .Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: 305014-Đại Long -Hoàng Thanh-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mới is 56 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 305014 Đại Long Hoàng Thanh solidarity group. 
With her 2 dependents, she lives and works in the Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province. Mrs Mới works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that affects her is the lack of capital. Mới is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise for sale in the future.

In 2007, Mới joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has since successfully repaid 5 loans from them.

With her business profit, Mới hopes to buy a new motobike, to maintain her business, and to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise for sale in the future

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 35-year-old married man with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a banker by profession and his major goal is to complete his professional course. Alex needs the loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: To pay his own school fees.

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Ahmad, who is in his early 20s, is single. He has been running a second hand clothes business for four years now. He works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more clothes, which he sells from door to door. He also paid the rent for the room where he stays and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase his stock of second hand clothes to sell.  His dream is to one day be able to open a shop to sell his clothes.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mango", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ibrohimchon

texts.ru: Иброхимчон проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 21 год. Холост. У него имеется столовая, где он работает поваром. В этой области Иброхимчон уже год. Он берет кредит для ремонта столовой.
texts.en: Ibrohimchon lives in the town of Khujand.  He is 21 years old, single.  He has a cafe, where he works as a chef.  Ibrohimchon has been in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his cafe.

loans.use: to make repairs to his cafe

loans.name: 0306029-Quang Trung -Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thuỷ works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and then sell in the future.

Thuỷ is 30 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 0306029 Quang Trung Hoằng Thanh solidarity group. 

She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents (she lives with an old mother).

In 2008, Thuỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thuỷ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thuỷ has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thuỷ hopes to maintain her business, to remodel her house and to make enough money to provide for her kid.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and then sell

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business. She operates from home and her neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transport in her business. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 50-year-old single woman with only one child living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a family dream of constructing rental houses. Mary deals in selling used clothes. She takes the clothes to different markets around the area. Her major challenge has been high transport costs and her desire is to have a big boutique. She needs the loan to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Neva

texts.en:
Neva is a 23-year-old woman. She is married and has no kids at the moment. She lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Neva develops her business interest at a young age. She has installed a food stall in the local community selling different viands and other snack items at very affordable prices. Her husband is helping her do the job, which enables and strengthens their relationship as husband and wife. The business has existed for three years, allowing them to earn a monthly income of PHP 8,500. She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase additional food items to sell.

Neva has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. This is her third loan from the cooperative. In the future, Neva plans to improve and expand the business to gain more income. She plans as well to widen the area and add more tables and seats to accommodate more customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items to sell.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 35 years old and married. She has two school-aged children to attend to. She resides in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines with the whole family.

Pablita owns and operates a specialized retail store in the local community. She offers some soft and hard drinks and most of the basic commodities. She has operated the business for over four years. She earns approximately PHP 9,500 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase more soft and hard drinks to sell. 

Pablita joined GDMPC earlier this year. She is looking forward to another loan after the total repayment of her current loan. She hopes to expand and improve the business to gain more income for the family and have her children finish a degree in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more soft and hard drinks to sell.

loans.name: 0303024-Trung Hải -Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hợp operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to catch fish.

Hợp is 54 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 0303024 Trung Hải Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hóa solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents.

In 2010, Hợp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hợp has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hợp has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hợp hopes to buy a new motorbike, to remodel her house, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase tools to catch fish

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is a 39-year-old married man. He lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines together with his three school-aged children and wife.

For the past five years, Randy has spent ample time attending to the general store he owns. He sells various goods, basic commodities, school and office paraphernalia in the local community. He runs the business with faith and dedication. Each month, he gets a total of PHP 6,000 from his store. Because he aims to prosper, Randy has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding the store inventory.

Randy joined GDMPC in 2010. This is his fifth loan from the cooperative. In the future, he aspires for a gradual business improvement and expansion to cover every day consumptions and his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his store.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 27-year-old married man with two children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His major dream is to see all his children go through higher education. He sells used clothes, a business he has carried out for the last seven years. He complains of irregular sales due to the rainy season and his dream is to own a boutique. John needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married. She lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines with her five children and husband. 

Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail store at home to earn a living. She sells canned goods, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, bath and laundry soap, school supplies, candles, etc. She has been running the store for over five years. Each month, Teresita is able to generate an approximate total income of PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional goods to sell. 

In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC. She took out several loans from the cooperative and expects to take more in the future and maximize the use of it for business expansion and development.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Turwanyubukene/ Kzr Group

texts.fr:
Donatien fait partie du groupe Turwanyubukene/KZR. Le nom du groupe signifie «Luttons contre la pauvreté ».Il a 54 et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 7 à 33 ans, dont 5 scolarisés.son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Donatien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres champs à cultiver. Dans les prochaines années, Donatien voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa région et récolter la grande quantité du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et les soigner.
texts.en:
Donatien is a member of Turwanyubukene/KZR Group, whose name means "Let's fight against poverty". He's 54 years old and married with six children, aged 7 to 33. Five children attend school. He himself attended elementary school for six years. 

Donatien is a rice cultivator. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB, in order to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business.

His strategy for growth is to buy other fields to farm. In the forthcoming years, he would like to be amongst the best rice cultivators in his region, and harvest large quantities of rice. With his profits, he intends to provide his children with education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman with one child who is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provisioning of family basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and water. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past one year; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of easy access to affordable loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a 40 years old mother who is engages in direct selling of AVON, NATASHA and MSE products in her village to generate income. She has three school-age children who are now in secondary education. Despite financial difficulty, she wants to continue sending her children to school because she wants them to earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Sally aimed to improve her business to increase her income. She wants to ask an additional capital of P15,000 to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, roll-on, bags, shoes and jewelry to sell in her village. She believes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will improve the business and makes it viable and a profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body sprays, underwear, roll-on, bags, shoes and jewelry for sale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past year, she has operated a food vending business, cooking mahamri (dumplings) and fried potatoes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sacks of potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: 02.06.03.đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Lý is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 02.06.03 Đông Hải solidarity group. With her 2 dependents, she lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs Lý has a service business tailoring clothes. Lý has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Lý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to provide tailoring and clothing repair services. 

In 2010, Lý joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has since successfully repaid 6 loans from them.
In the future, Lý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase machines to provide tailoring and clothing repair services.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба жительница города Худжанд. Она замужем. Ей 39 лет. У нее четверо детей. Ее дети учатся в школе. Сама она имеет среднее образование. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа двух бычков и коровы.
texts.en: Nasiba lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 39 years old, married and has four children.  Her children attend a school.  Nasiba has a secondary education.  She earns a living by breeding cattle.  She primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of two bulls and a cow.

loans.use: to buy two bulls and a cow

loans.name: 03.7.01 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hoá Group

texts.en:
Huyền works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in future.

Huyền is 25 years old, married and has one child. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 01 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoá city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

This is Huyền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Huyền has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main harship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Huyền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise to sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Zabib

texts.en: Zabib is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. Zabib requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to order more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en: Fareeda is a 30-year-old young woman who is married and has three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Fareeda wants to purchase new home furniture to live in better conditions with her family. She wants to purchase bedroom furniture for her children, living room seats, etc, but because of the salary her husband gets, she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Fareeda gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase the home furniture she needs to improve her family life and provide better conditions at home. Fareeda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a grocery shop business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her place of operation. Mwanamisi dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase green grocery items for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase green grocery items to sell

loans.name: 03.08.88 Thiệu Toán Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh works in agriculture. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Thanh is 27 years old and married with no children.

Thanh is the group leader of the 88 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

She lives and works in Thiệu Hóa, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2008, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Rhona

texts.en: Rhona lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who both go to school. She has additional family members. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 20 years. She has requested for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing price of charcoal. Her inspiration and goal is to build rental houses in the future. Rhona lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expense includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a 45-year-old married woman with five children living in her permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to buy more land and a motor vehicle and to build a commercial house for her business. Oliver operates a restaurant and her major challenge has been high labor turnover and workers agitating for high pay, which she cannot afford yet. Nevertheless, she intends to expand her restaurant. Oliver needs the loan to buy rice and sugar sacks for use in the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar sacks for use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who both go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last six years. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Annet generates additional income by selling fried popcorn. Her major challenge includes transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to make enough profit so that she can buy a delivery van and a plot of land. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: 040905-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thực operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to catch fish.

Thực is 27 years old and married with three children. 

She is the leader of a six-member group, the 040905 Liên Minh Hoằng Trường solidarity group. 

Thực lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Thực joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thực has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thực has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thực hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase tools to catch fish

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам проживает в городе Чкаловск. Возраст, 37 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он предоставляет услугу. Развозит людей по маршруту №87 Худжанд - Б. Гафуров. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины марки Газель.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the town of Chkalovsk.  He is 37 years old, married and has four children.  He provides a service and transports people along the #87 Khujand - B. G. route.  Rustam has been involved in this business for 12 years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his Gazel vehicle.

loans.use: to make repairs to his Gazel vehicle

loans.name: 0407012-Thành Xuân -Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Duyên is 47 years old and is married with 4 children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 0407012 Thành Xuân Hoằng Trường solidarity group. With her 3 dependents, she lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Duyên operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that affects her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to catch fish.

In 2010, Duyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has since successfully repaid 2 loans from them. With her business profit, Duyên hopes for her business to do well, to buy more land, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase tools to catch fish

loans.name: 01.02.02 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Nhung is 52 years old and is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 01.02.02 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in the Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

Mrs Nhung operates a food stall, selling fish sauce. Nhung has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a L. to purchase fish sauce for resale.

In 2004, Nhung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business and has since successfully repaid 6 loans from them.
With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fish sauce for resale

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband repair his truck, which he uses for providing a goods transport services. He is an expert driver and has been driving his truck for the past 20 years. With the loan, he will repair his truck and replace the tires.
  
Robina hopes that the fully repaired truck will allow her husband to drive more comfortably and improve his transportation business.
 
She herself is a housewife and performs her household duties very efficiently. She has given birth to four children. Three of the children are studying while the youngest one is yet of school-going age. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained  good credit and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To repair her husband's truck

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. 

Vivian requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: 03.12.89 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tuyết works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and then sell in the future.

Tuyết is 26 years old and married with one child.

Tuyết is the group leader of the 89 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of four members.
 
She lives with one dependent in Thiệu Hóa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyết has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyết has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of skills.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes to make enough money to provide for her kid, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise to sell in the future

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 30-year-old married man with two children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in clothes for four years. He started his business with 2,000,000 shillings and now has 5,000,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardship is increased prices for the clothes and his vision is a big boutique, buying vehicles and a good house. Stephen needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: 040904-Liên Minh -Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sáu operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to catch fish.

Sáu is 25 years old and married with two children.

She is the leader of a six-member group, the 040904 Liên Minh Hoằng Trường solidarity group.
 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Sáu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Sáu has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sáu hopes to be healthy and happy, to remodel her house, and to buy more land.

loans.use: to purchase tools to catch fish

loans.name: 01.03.08 .đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quyết has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair service.

Quyết is 42 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 08 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Quyết's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Quyết has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Quyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Quyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair service.

loans.name: Kashi

texts.en: Kashi has been able to repay her first Kiva loan fully and she is taking a bigger loan of 50,000 KES to expand to another business. With the loan, she wants to start another business selling charcoal and coconuts, by purchasing sacks of charcoal and coconuts for resale.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is a forty two year old widow with three children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the pharmacy business for eleven years. She received her initial capital from her former employment at a clinic as a nurse. Her hardships are increased taxes and high rent. Her vision is owning a pharmancy and educating her children. Joice needs the loan facility to buy drugs for sale.

loans.use: to buy drugs for sale

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is a thirty-four year old single mother of three children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for four years. She started with one million shillings of working capital and now has three million shillings of working capital. Her hardship is limited capital to meet the tastes of customers and her vision is running a wholesale shop and educating her children. Peace needs the loan facility to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
This is Girlie, 21, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Renante, her business partner, and is a mother to three children. The eldest child is already in college while the youngest is still in elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Girlie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also retails rice & electronic cell phone loading. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 550 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Girlie hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and other products for sale

loans.name: Sovetkan

texts.ru: Советкан 47 лет, замужем и имеет двух детей. Начиная с 1991 года, Советкан успешно занимается откормом и перепродажей скота.  Стартовав с начальной суммой 20,000 сом (KGS), Советкан сумела развить хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 7,000 сом (KGS) и приобрести кошару и дом на окраине села. Такое местоположение стало удобным для выпаса скота и  продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Для дальнейшего роста своего бизнеса, Советкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Советкан планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья  и закупку корма .
texts.en: Sovetkan is 47 years old, married and has two children.  Since 1991, Sovetkan has been successfully involved in fattening up and reselling livestock.  Starting with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS), Sovetkan was able to develop her business to yield a monthly income of 7,000 som (KGS) and to buy a barn and a house on the outskirts of the village.  This location became convenient for feeding livestock and selling milk and meat products.  In order to further grow her business, Sovetkan requested a loan in the sum of 55,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into increasing livestock headcount and purchase of fodder.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Getrida

texts.en: Getrida is a thirty-two year old married woman with four children. She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling soda and salted fish for five years. Her vision is to finish constructing her house plus educating her children. Getrida needs the loan to buy fish and soda for sale

loans.use: to buy fish and soda for sale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with one child who is still young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity bit not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated an electronics shop business. Neighboring community members are her customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase electronics for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase electronics for resale.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Jennifer requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business by purchasing more fish for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Monica Wambui

texts.en:
Monica is a married lady with two children whom they hope to provide with a good education to university level. She lives on an estate called Dandora in Nairobi where she operates a restaurant business. She has been doing this business for the last six years and has managed to hire four staff members. 

Monica says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to ensure her business is doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to renovate the restaurant to create an ambience which is more appealing to her customers. She describes herself as clean and honest.

loans.use: to renovate the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal, beans and maize flour.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, aged 43, is a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Angelito, a driver, and is mother to their four children. The eldest is already working. Two are in college while the youngest is still in high school. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually proviD. income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. AsiD. from this she also offers direct selling products to her customers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Ann hopes her business will grow more in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Amirchon

texts.ru: Амирчон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Amirchon lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 30 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Amirchon provides a taxi service.  He has been involved in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with four children, one of whom attends school while the other three are still too young for school. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a café business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase building materials to establish a café business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to establish a café business.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 44-year-old woman. She is married and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Sabah wants to make repairs to her house including painting and changing doors and windows. However, because of her husband's decent salary, she hasn't enough money to pay and needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Sabah takes the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for making repairs to her house and live in better conditions with her family. Sabah is a conservative religious woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to pay for repairing her house.

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a bamboo supply business. He provides bamboo to different construction companies and also provides them on a rental basis. With the loan, he will buy bamboo in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill client orders on time and increase his income.

Amna is a very good housewife and performs her household duties very efficiently. She is very confident that her family’s life will get better after making an investment into her husband’s business. Her husband has been operating his business for the past five years and she is very sure that it will definitely improve after the investment.

loans.use: To buy bamboo

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy serving plates, rice, maize flour and bunches of bananas. Her major challenge includes the ever increasing prices of foodstuffs and transportation. 

Mary's goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant, to build rental houses and also build her own restaurant. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bananas, rice, serving plates and maize flour

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling fish in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. The extra income will help to pay for the children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Khayridin

texts.ru: Хайридин житель города Вахдат. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Хайридин занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух голов бычков.
texts.en: Khayridin lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 39 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Khayridin is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for future sale.  He has been in this business for 15 years.  Khayridin is requesting this loan for the purchase of two heads of bulls.

loans.use: to buy two heads of bulls

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, aged 69, is a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Benigno, who assists her with the business, and is mother to their three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Violeta operates a piggery business. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 4,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Violeta hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration there from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs.

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice is a married woman with four children none of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Rejoice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase or order more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou est un homme marié de 34 ans qui vit  sur  le territoire sénégalais. Il a 4 enfants et s’active dans le secteur de la mécanique.  Il s’est investi dans ce secteur d’activité depuis le bas âge sous l’influence de son grand frère  qui pratiquait la même activité. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2008. Il a déjà soldé 4 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pièces détachées  à moindre cout. Ces pièces  détachées serviront a assurer la bonne qualité de ses services en cas de réparation des véhicules qu’on lui soumet.  Ce financement lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son activité et par conséquent d’  améliorer le niveau de vie social de sa famille  a travers l’accroissement de  ses  revenus.
texts.en: Mamadou is 34 years old and lives in Senegal. He is married with 4 children, and is a mechanic. He learned the trade as a young boy, working alongside his grandfather. He has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since October 2008 and has fully repaid 4 previous loans. He is requesting a 500 000 franc loan so that he can buy low cost spare parts, which will be used to fix the cars that his customers bring in. This financing will enable him to make his business more profitable, and he will use the additional income to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Izatullo

texts.ru: Изатулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 50 лет. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Изатулло зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области он уже 19 лет. Он берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Izatullo lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 50 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Izatullo earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been in this business for 19 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Samarkan's Group

texts.en:
Samarkan is the leader of this group. She is 40 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she brings up three sons. The first son studies at school and the other two are preschool age. In 1995, with an initial investment of 2,000 soms, Samarkan started to sell grocery goods. At the moment her monthly profit is about 7,500 soms. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more home products, such as macaroni, sugar and oil. In the future with the profits gained from the trade she plans to expand the business.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase macaroni, sugar and oil to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 23 years old and is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, beans and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Pain De Vie Plus Group

texts.en:
“Pain deVie Plus” is a group of 27 owners of small businesses chaired by Philo. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Philo’s main activity is selling purified water. Besides that, she also sells prepaid cards. She is a hard-working woman who has demonstrated some abilities in business such as organisation and good management. Philo is planning with the next loan to increase the stock of her goods by buying some containers of purified water and some prepaid cards in order to meet the high demand of her customers in her community and generate more profit. Her business brings in profit of US$20 each day. 

Philo is confident with her business. She knows how to attract her customers by offering what they need and like. She is also diplomatic when she talks with her clients. Philo’s medium term plan is to open a purified water facility in order to store more containers to meet her community’s needs for purified water. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children aged 21 and 23.

loans.use: to purchase containers of purified water and prepaid cards for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Serigne M.m.

texts.fr: Monsieur Serigne est âgé de 28 ans. Il vit au Sénégal et évolue dans  domaine de la couture.                         C’est en 2001 après qu’il ait abandonné les études qu’il a commencé à s’activer dans cette activité. Pour lui les périodes de fêtes  religieuses sont ses moment favoris car c’est en ces  moments qu’il parvient a enregistrer  le maximum  de ses chiffres d’affaire. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis  Aout 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et autres accessoires  destinés a la confection d’habits   prêts  a être  porter  en  vue des préparatifs  de la fête  de Tabaski. Ce  financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices durant cette période.
texts.en: Serigne is 28 years old and lives in Senegal. He left school in 2001 to start a career in tailoring and especially likes the religious festival season, as he does the most business during those days. He has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since August 2011. He is requesting a 300 000 franc loan which he will use to buy fabric and the other sewing accessories he needs to be able to make clothes to be worn during the festival of Tabaski. This financing will allow him to increase his profits during the festival period.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing accessories needed to make clothes for resale.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children who all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (her mother). She operates a pub  and sells both on a wholesale and retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last seven years. 

Norah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, jerry cans of local gin and boxes of water. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to educate her children to university level and also to build rental houses. She lives in her house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, jerry cans of local gin and boxes of water

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling tomatoes and onions in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Esther requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more tomatoes and onions to sell. The extra income will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en:
Nasanjargal is 53 years old and has one son, age 28. She lives with her family in the outer Ger district, a district without basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She has run an auto repair service business for the past few years because the Mongolian aftermarket is very popular.  

She initially rented a small container, which is located at the largest local auto market in Mongolia, with her son operating the business. Nasanjargal purchased her products & auto supplies from other wholesale suppliers and sometimes from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 
   
Then her family decided to own this container, bought using their working capital, so they don’t have enough money to purchase necessary products needed by their customers. For this reason Nasanjargal is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase products and improve her business in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase products and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cabbages, green vegetables, potatoes and onions, and renovate her stall.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru: Махмуд житель города Душанбе. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Его сын находится на заработках в России. Сам Махмуд имеет среднее образование. Он имеет пекарню, где печет лепешки. Вместе с ним работают четверо ребят, его родственники. В этой области Махмуд уже шесть лет. Он берет кредит для покупки муки, угля и для ремонта пекарни.
texts.en: Mahmud lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 40 years old, married and has one child.  His son is working in Russia.  Mahmud has a secondary education.  He owns a bakery, where he bakes flatbread.  Four of his relatives work with him as well.  Mahmud has been in this business for six years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour, coal and to make repairs to his bakery.

loans.use: to purchase flour, coal and to make repairs to his bakery

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and rent bills.

For the past 10 years, he has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the dry hot season, the availability of green vegetables is lower compared to rainy seasons. He dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 loan, he wants to renovate his vegetable stall, and buy green vegetables and tomatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To renovate his vegetable stall, and buy green vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Abdou Khadre

texts.fr: commerçant dans une ville qui se trouve au sénégal, ce prêt a pour but de payer les frais d'hospitalisation de sa femme qui doit accouché. Ayant une bénéfice qui ne peut pas comblé toutes les frais médicaux, il sollicite un prêt qui n'est pas a but commerçiale. Depuis plus de 10 ans il fait du commerce avec le financement de la banque avec un activité fructueux la banque lui accorde des prêts pour mener a bien son activité.
texts.en:
Abdou Khadre is a merchant in a town in Senegal. This loan will go to pay the medical bills for his wife who is pregnant.   His income is not sufficient to pay all the medical costs and therefore he is requesting a loan that is not for business purposes.  For over ten years he has been doing business with financing from the bank.  Since his work is profitable, the bank grants him loans so that he can conduct his business.


commerçant dans une ville qui se trouve au sénégal, ce prêt a pour but de payer les frais d'hospitalisation de sa femme qui doit accouché. Ayant une bénéfice qui ne peut pas comblé toutes les frais médicaux, il sollicite un prêt qui n'est pas a but commerçiale. Depuis plus de 10 ans il fait du commerce avec le financement de la banque avec un activité fructueux la banque lui accorde des prêts pour mener a bien son activité.

loans.use: to  pay his wife's medical bills.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a constructor. Together with her husband she brings up two sons. The older son studies at school and the second son is preschool age (under seven). 

Seven years ago with an initial investment of 4,000 soms she started to sell dried fruits. In this way she earns about 5,000 soms per month. With the profits gained from the trade Damira was able to purchase three cows for breeding.  

She applies for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase building materials for house repairing. In the future Damira wants to provide her sons with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair the house.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Charity requested this loan through BRAC in South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal for resale. She says that the profit from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to his personal savings and purchase a freezer for storing fish.

loans.name: Himoyat's Group

texts.en:
Himoyat is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a constructor, whose monthly salary is 5,000 soms. Together they have raised two sons and a daughter. The daughter works in Russia, the first son is a constructor and the younger son is a farmer. 

Himoyat is engaged in the cultivation of agricultural products. She has been growing cotton for 12 years. In this way she earns about 6,000 soms per month. At the moment she is applying for the loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers. 

Some part of the loan she will use to contribute money to her son’s wedding. In the near future she hopes to get a good harvest.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Aida Fary

texts.fr: Madame Aida habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et gère un atelier de couture dans un marché de la place non loin de la  localité ou elle habite. Elle est secondée par 2 apprentis.  Elle a d’abord travaillé dans une entreprise  de la place ce qui lui a permis de constater que c’était une activité  porteuse. Pendant les périodes de fête  religieuses son activité est en pleine extension. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2006 et a déjà bénéficié de 3 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour l’achat  d’une nouvelle  machine a coudre plus performante. Son objectif est de mieux rentabiliser son activité, maximiser ses bénéfices pour mieux supporter ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Madame Aida lives in Senegal.  She is 43 years old.  She is married and manages a sewing shop at a market not far from where she lives.   Two apprentices work with her.  She began working at a business in her area which showed her that this was profitable work.  During the religious festivities her work increases considerably.  She has been a member of l’U-IMCEC since November 2006 and has already taken out three previous loans.   She is requesting a loan of 250,000 frs to buy a more sophisticated sewing machine. Her goal is to make her work more profitable and maximize her income to better meet her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mekhdi

texts.en:
Mekhdi is 38 and married with two children. He has run his small business for the last 10 years, selling food products. His wife is a housekeeper, however she actively helps Mekhdi. 

His monthly profit from this business is about 400 USD and he would like to increase it. Mekhdi has good client history and wants to reinvest his profits.

loans.use: purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Margo

texts.ru:
Марго родилась в 1956 году. Она проживает в деревне Ачаджур (Achajur) со свей семье. Марго замужем и у нее двое детей. Дочь замужем и живет отдельно от родителей, а сын вместе с отцом периодически выезжают на сезонную работу в Россию. 
На протяжении 36 лет Марго работает бухгалтером в сельской школе и параллельно занимается сельским хозяйством. Раньше ей помогал муж и они разводили крупный рогатый скот, но так как в последнее муж часто уезжал, она стала разводить только кур. Занимаясь разведением птицы, Марго, по мере возможностей, помогает мужу и сыну содержать семью. 
Для увеличения доходов своей семьи Марго решила купить одну корову, а так же запасти на зиму сено для нее. Для этого Марго необходим кредит на сумму 600.000 драм.
texts.en: Margo was born in 1956.  She lives in the Achajur village together with her family.  Margo is married and has two children.  Her daughter is married and lives separately from the parents, and her son and husband periodically travel for seasonal work to Russia.  Margo has been working as an accountant at the village school for 36 years and has been involved in agriculture parallel to her work.  Previously, her husband used to help her with the business, and they bred cattle, but because her husband often leaves now, she started to breed only chickens.  Being involved in breeding chickens, Margo is able to help her husband and son to support the family as much as possible.  In order to increase her family's income, Margo decided to buy a cow and also stock some fodder for it for the winter.  Margo needs a loan in the sum of 600,000 dram for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder

loans.name: Kazawa

texts.en:
Kazawa is a married woman with eight children, five of whom are in school. She has a business of selling clothes in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Kazawa requested this loan through BRAC in South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 5 children, and all go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a pub at the shop that she rents. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 7 years. 

She has requested a loan of 1,700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of local gin, crates of beer and soda. Margret generates additional income through a restaurant. Her major challenges include thieves, transportation and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to own a fully stocked pub. 

She lives in a house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills and rent.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda, and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a widow with five children, three of whom graduated from school while two still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, beans, sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a fifty-one-year-old married man with three children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been farming for ten years. Formerly he was into banana farming and later diversified to growing coffee, cassava, cabbages and beans. 

His hardship is limited financial resources and his vision is to have higher yields plus a permanent house. Julius needs the loan facility to buy beans and till the land.

loans.use: to buy beans and till the land.

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the salon business and also running a video library for two years. His hardship is customers not returning films on time. His vision is to have a large stock of films, to sell computers and to educate his children. Hannington needs the loan facility to buy films, a printer and a modem for his video library.

loans.use: to buy films, a printer and a modem for his video library.

loans.name: Nayanjin

texts.en:
Nayanjin is a 30-year-old hardworking young woman who is married and has a three-year-old son who attends kindergarten. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

Since 2005, she and her spouse have been operating a plastic barrel and water container selling business at the second largest outdoor market in Mongolia. They have two stalls, one operated by her, other operated by her husband. They purchase products from other wholesale suppliers and during summer time from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

Over the past few years, Nayanjin and her spouse have expanded their business and with their business profit they bought a new yard and the ger. Nayanjin is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ to purchase more products to sell for fall and winter. She is planning to build a new house on her own yard next year.

loans.use: to puchase plastic barrels and water containers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
