loans.use: To renovate the school and add chairs and tables for the increasing number of pupils.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a 25-year-old, hardworking man living in a family house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to see his siblings complete university. He is a company driver and has been in service for two years. His challenge is the meager salary earned, and his dream is to set up a business. 

Collins needs the loan to pay school fees for his siblings.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his siblings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a poultry business, purchase poultry feeds and add more chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay labour for tea plantation maintenance.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 32-year-old married man with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main dream is to build a good permanent house for his family and educate his children. Robert operates a bar, a business he has operated for two years. His major challenge is the high cost of electricity and his dream is to set up a modern hotel. Robert needs a loan to buy crates of beer and sodas for resale.

loans.use: to buy crates of beer and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier to charcoal sellers in the region. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and none of them go to school. She has one additional family member (her mother). She sells bunches of bananas at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for less than a year. 

Madina has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  Madina generates additional income through cooked food vending. Her major challenge includes thieves and seasonality. Her goal and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to build rental houses. She lives in her house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a street food business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability of her products. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to establish a restaurant business and purchase stock of beans, rice, sugar and bundles of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To establish a restaurant business and purchase stock of beans, rice, sugar and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a retail  shop at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last five years. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more  bags of sugar, cartons of salt,  jerrycans of cooking oil and boxes of soap. 

Betty's major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation costs. She lives in her own house and  the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying for electricity charges,  and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: To buy more  bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom graduated from school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past ten years, she has operated a street food business, selling to town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to own a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes and tomatoes and establish a place to sell her products. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes and tomatoes and establish a place to sell her products.

loans.name: Kazia

texts.en:
Kazia is 30 years old, a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has been in this business for three years.

Kazia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beans for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans for sale.

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Salif habite au sud du sénégal.Agé de 31 ans célibataire sans enfant.Depuis 2007,il s'est lancé dans le commerce d'alimentation,qui fonctionne trés bien avec l'emplacement de sa boutique au centre de la ville.
Salif démare sa jounée de 08h termine à 23h.Il est trés actif dans son commerce,avec ses bénéfices ,il soutiends sa famille étant le fils aine de la famille.Dans les prochaines années ,il veut ouvrir une autre boutique pour associer ses petits frére dans son commerce pour mieux gérer leur famille.
texts.en: Salif lives in southern Senegal. He is 31 years old, single and has no children. He has been selling food from his shop, favourably located in the center of town, since 2007. He is very industrious; his workdays start at 8 am and end at 11 pm. Being the eldest child, he uses his profits to support his family. In the coming years he would like to open another store and, in order to better manage the family´s needs, he plans to employ his younger brothers.

loans.use: to restock on products including drinks (Coke, Fanta and fruit juices), pineapple and eggs.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a cafeteria since 2009 and has almost three years of experience working in the same occupation. With his requested loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase a coffee machine for his shop. He states that with this machine, he will be able to satisfy his customers' demand and allow them to enjoy their time while visiting his cafeteria. This will be his first Kiva loan and he hopes that it will help him achieve remarkable growth in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a coffee machine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace needs another loan to pay school fees for her children. She is a fifty-year-old married woman with eight children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She was able to pay school fees for her children with the previous loan.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is 40 years old, a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Clementina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the profit from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim, a 51-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children, is an experienced freelance aluminum worker who also works at a local company operating within the same occupation. Involved in the aluminum field for the past 15 years, Ibrahim is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase tools and supplies needed for his work. In the future, he plans to open his own aluminum factory.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies needed for his work.

loans.name: Mary Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married lady with two children whom they hope to give a good education up to the university level. She operates an automobile spares parts sales business along the Jogoo Road in Nairobi. She has been in this business for 12 years now and has hired one person. She says the business is good and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works hard to ensure that business is doing well.

She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to add to her stock of auto parts to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that in the future her business will grow to a wholesale business. She describes herself as hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts

loans.name: Dushyirehamwe/sngnr Group

texts.fr:
Fidele fait partie du groupe Dushyirehamwe. Le nom du groupe signifie «mettons-nous ensemble ».Il a 36 et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 3 à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarisés et il a une personne en charge plus que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 8 ans de primaire. 

Fidele est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est cultivée à temps. Dans les prochaines années, Fidele voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa région et avoir la grande production du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants et les soigner.

Note sur la photo: Au lieu d'Ali, sa femme se figure sur la photo. Elle est la deuxième à partir de la droite.
texts.en:
Fidèle is a member of Dushyirehamwe Group, whose name means "let's get together". He's 36 years old, married, and has three children, age 3 to 8. One of them attends school. In addition, he has another person to support. He attended elementary school for 8 years.

Fidèle is a rice cultivator and he is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. He will use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business. His strategy for growth is to plant on time. With his profits, he intends to provide education and healthcare to his children.

Note: Ali (another member of the group) is not in the photograph, but his wife is in it instead. She's the second person from the right.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and food products for food vending business

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 48-year-old married woman with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to build her own permanent house. 

Violet is a primary school teacher and has been in teaching for 10 years.  She needs the Kiva loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 48-year-old married man living with his wife and five children.  Four of his children are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as a metal trader since 1980. He works on a freelance basis selling used metal to customers located in different areas and villages.

Today he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new van in order to expand his business. He plans to hire a full-time employee whose job will be to help him distribute his products to the markets. In the future, he hopes to open his own metal shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new van in order to expand his business

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced with 4 children and none of the children go to school. She takes care of an additional family member (mother). She sells secondhand children’s clothes at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 5 years. She also has rental houses where she gets additional income.

She has requested a loan of 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand children’s clothes. Her major business challenges includes transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspirations are to buy another plot of land and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand children's clothes

loans.name: Anait

texts.ru:
Анаит 30 лет, она проживает в городе Иджеване (Ijevan) со своим мужем, двумя детьми и родителями мужа. Дочь Анаит учится в школе, сыну 5 лет, а муж и свекор работают водителями. 
Анаит работает в городской администрации, а после работы дома шьет занавески на заказ. Свекровь Анаит помигает ей с шитьем и вместе они выполняют не только заказы частных лиц, но и заказы небольших гостиниц и ресторанов. Анаит говорит, что у них всегда очень много заказов и очень часто они работают до поздней ночи. Благодаря бизнесу Анаит и ее свекровь обеспечивают основные потребности своей семьи, так как зарплаты водителя недостаточно для содержания семьи. 
Анаит необходим кредит на сумму 850.000 драм для покупки материала и разнообразных аксессуаров для выполнения своих заказов.
texts.en: Anait is 30 years old.  She lives in the town of Ijevan together with her husband, two children and her parents-in-law.  Anait's daughter attends a school, her son is 5 years old, and her husband and father-in-law work as drivers.  Anait works at the town administrative office and makes window drapes to-order at home after work.  Her mother-in-law helps her with the sewing, and together they fill not only individual orders, but orders from small hotels and restaurants.  Anait says that they always have many orders, and they often work nights.  Thanks to this business, Anait and her mother-in-law are able to provide for the family's basic needs because a driver's salary is not enough to support the family.  Anait needs a loan in the sum of 850,000 dram for the purchase of materials and various accessories for filling her orders.

loans.use: to buy materials and various accessories for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and establish a selling stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and establish a selling stall.

loans.name: Leon

texts.en: Leon is a 27-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and only sibling. He started his career in 2005 working in installing solar energy systems in houses. He works independently in his business. With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase new equipment that will help him install solar energy systems more easily. In the future, he plans to open his own shop and start dealing with a bigger number of customers to earn good income and be able to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment that will help him install solar energy systems more easily.

loans.name: Jilani

texts.en:
Jilani is a married man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past eight years, he has operated a shoe designing business,  selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing materials in his business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a machine for shoe designing. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for shoe designing.

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en:
Sisi  is a married woman with one child who is not yet schooling. She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Sisi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase or order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan  for building a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ramy

texts.en:
Ramy is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and only sibling. Since he was very young, he was obsessed with everything related to music, so he got involved in this field six years ago and he finally opened his own store. His job consists in selling CD’s and organizing music for weddings, social events, etc. In parallel, he works in a local university to earn more income. 

Today, Ramy is requesting to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, to enlarge his business operation by purchasing additional musical instruments etc. He is very positive and hopes to apply for more Kiva loans in the future.

loans.use: purchasing additional musical instruments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, he has operated a fish-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of competition from other fish sellers in the area. He dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Doumit

texts.en:
D. is a 42-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife, four children and two cousins. 

He has owned a mini market since 2009, where he sells different types of food products. 

This will be his second Kiva loan, and we note that he has been a very reliable client with payments on time. 

Today, he is asking to borrow $1,800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new merchandise to increase his sales and therefore his income. In the future, he hopes to enlarge his business operation into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise to increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 45 years old and married to David, and together they have three children. She sells clothes. She has been in this business for the last six years and gets an income of KES.26,800 per month.

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD and she plans to buy rolls of materials with the whole amount. 

She will use the extra profit to educate her children and also improve her living standard. She hopes to open a boutique. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy rolls of material.

loans.name: Silvana

texts.en:
Silvana is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, who are still attending school. 

She has been running a successful bakery since 2000. She produces tasty Lebanese breads and pastries. 

This will be her third Kiva loan. It is encouraging to learn that she has indeed increased her productivity and income since taking the previous loans. And she was a very punctual client. 

Today, to continue expansion of her business, Silvana is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her purchases of items such as flour and foods used in baking. Her income is very important to help support her husband and four children.

loans.use: to increase her purchases of flour and foods used in baking.

loans.name: Houreye

texts.fr: Commerçante depuis plus de dix ans ou elle s'active dans ce domaine dans une enclave de la capitale du Sénégal, cette femme s'active dans le domaine du commerce plus précisément dans la vente de tissus et d'autre produits divers telsque des habits prêts a porté. Le but de ce prêt lui permettra de se renforcer en marchandises et de s'approvisionner afin de repondre a l'attente de ses clients.Son fond de roulement etand a la baisse elle veut se renforcer pour combler son stock de marchandises
texts.en: This lady has been a trader for more than ten years in an enclave of the capital of Senegal. She is more specifically a trader of fabrics and other products, such as ready-to-wear clothing. This loan will enable her to boost her stock and get fresh supplies in order to meet customer demand. Her working capital is diminishing and she wants to strengthen it in order to build up her stocks.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and various products

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman with five children, four of whom are in the school.

She has a business of selling clothes in Hai Gwafa Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes for sale. The extra income from this loan she will use for building a shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 30 years old. She is married and they have two children age 10 and 3 years old. 

She runs a beauty salon business which is located at the busy Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa. In her salon, she has been providing hair and beauty services to the local women. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, and hence, customers are spoiled for choice. 

However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of KES 30,000 to buy more hair relaxers, treatments and weaves to expand her business. She is very hard-working, humble and God-fearing.

loans.use: To buy hair relaxers, treatments, weaves and other additions.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has seven children, and five of the children go to school. She has one additional family member. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

She operates a grocery stall at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last five years.  

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bread, baking flour and cooking oil. 

Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to educate her children to university level and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: Top buy more cooking oil, baking flour, bread and cakes.

loans.name: Shady

texts.en:
Shady is a 33-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He has 13 years of experience working as a home painter. And in 2001, he started operating independently. 

In parallel, he has worked in a local company since 2000 in order to earn supplementary income. In Lebanon, It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. 

Today, Shady is applying for a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase a small car to facilitate his transportation to projects where he works. In the future, he looks forward to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to purchase a small car to facilitate his transportation towards projects where he works.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. 

In 2009, he started to work as logistic transactions laborer. He works hard since he has a job and simultaneously he is pursuing his education. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his university education fees. He is studying business administration and this is his second year. 

In the future, he is planning to start his career in a large company to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income.

loans.use: to pay for his university education fees.

loans.name: Tinevimbo Group

texts.en:
Blantina is 23 years old and lives in Gweru. She is single and has two children, age 6 and 2 years. The eldest attends school. She also cares for her parents.

She sells a range of items including footwear, clothing and blankets. Her main problems are the level of bureaucracy and competition. She has one employee.

Blantina will spend the money she borrows on more stock to sell in the market.

She hopes that her business will continue to help her to sustain her family and that it will grow over time.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, clothes and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Commerçante, elle vent des tissus et des habits. Habitant dans une ville qui se trouve a proximité de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal. Elle s'exerce sur ce métier depuis plus de 10 ans d'ou elle gagne beaucoup de profits. Ce crédit a pour but le renforcement de son fonds de roulements pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de répondre a la demande de ses clients ou la demande se fait beaucoup plus pressant pendant les vacances. Elle veut aussi acheter une machine a coudre pour faire des confection afin de vendre des habits prêts a portées.
texts.en:
This lady sells fabrics and clothing. She lives in a city near Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She started this activity over 10 years ago and earns substantial profits. 

She will use this credit to strengthen her working capital by stocking up on merchandise. She needs to be able to meet customer demand, especially during the peak periods of the holidays. She also wants to buy a sewing machine to make ready to wear clothes that she will sell.

loans.use: to stock up on fabrics and clothing for sale, and to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 7 children and all go to school. She has one additional family member. She lives in her house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Agnes sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 15 years. She has requested for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to sell wholesale only and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 50-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. She has established a computer business to help provide various types of reports and computer programs to members from her community and different companies. She is a relatively new business owner; she started her business operation two years ago. Today, she is requesting to borrow 2,000 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more equipment for her shop in order to build a larger clientele who are in need of computer services. In the future, Dalal looks for things to add that are of value so that her business can expand. This will be her second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her shop in order to build a large clientele who are in need of computer services

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and medicines

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en: Zahraa is a 21-year-old married woman living with her husband and one young child. She is from Lebanon. In 2008, she started running her own business working as a beautician receiving clients at her home. Her income is very important; she is supportive for her husband. Zahraa's story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges the Lebanese women are facing in running a business and at the same time raising children and taking care of their houses. Today, she is requesting to borrow 1,500 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laser machine for hair removal. In the future, Zahraa is planning to open a formal beauty salon in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a laser machine for hair removal

loans.name: Abadahemukirana / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Fréderic fait partie du groupe Abadahemukirana / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie « les fideles ». Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 1 à 8 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est  8 ans de primaire.

Fréderic est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est agrandir les champs à cultives. Dans les prochaines années, Fréderic voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa région et récolter la grande quantité du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigne ses enfants.
texts.en:
Frederic is a member of the Abadahemukirana/RSZ group. The name of the group means “the faithful ones.” He is 40 years old and married with four children between the ages of 1 and 8 years, two of whom attend school.  He has had 8 years of primary school education. 

Frederic is a rice farmer.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice growing operation.  

His strategy to grow his business is to increase the size of the fields he cultivates.  In the coming years, Frederic would like to be among the best rice growers in his region and to produce a large quantity of rice.  With his profits, he plans to pay for his children’s schooling and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers to use in his rice growing operation.

loans.name: Golden Flames Group

texts.en:
Sita is 41 years old and lives in Gweru. She is married, but her husband is currently unemployed. They have five children between the ages of 19 and 3, four of whom attend school. They also care for three other dependents.

Sita sells a range of items including shoes, children’s clothing and chicken. The principal problem she faces at present is lack of funds to buy stock to meet demand. She has two employees. Sita will use the money she borrows to buy shoes and chicken feed.  She hopes that this will enable her to rent a larger shop.

loans.use: To buy additional shoes and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to register a car and sign the legal papers

loans.name: 2182 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Callitex is 48 years old and is married, with two children between the ages of 4 and 18 years. He owns a business for selling clothes.

Callitex is the leader of this group, which is called "Abizeranye" in the local language. He is the first person on the right side. Callitex has been in this business for about two years and his business is open from 7 am until 6 pm every day.

Callitex and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their stock of clothes. Callixte and his team will reinvest their profits in their businesses and save for their families' future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a married woman.  She has no children.  She has a business of selling fish in the Hai Gwafa area, in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for three years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, to enable her to purchase more fish to sell.  The extra income from this loan will be used for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Esther Kambe

texts.en: Esther is fifty-two years old. She is widowed and has three grown up children. She runs a clothing store which is located at the busy Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa. She has been doing this business for ten years. She says that this business is profitable, and the only major challenge she has is the rising cost of clothes as a result of current inflation. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business and even build her own house. She describes herself as Godfearing, humble and customer friendly.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Lorde

texts.en: Lorde is a 20-year-old single woman living with her parents. She is from Lebanon. Despite her young age, she has been working for several years as a beautician. Her business is based at her home and she also works as freelancer beautician. With her business income, she is able to help her father with the household expenses. Today, she is requesting $1000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to invest in purchasing a vaporization machine and new beauty products. In the future, she hopes to open a formal beauty salon.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing a vaporization machine and new beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Johnston Kadzoyo

texts.en: Johnston is 33 years old, single and makes a living repairing bicycles and selling spare parts. He has been in this business for two years and says he is doing well. He is applying for a loan for KES 50,000 to buy more spare parts to sell to his customers. In the future, his ambition is to expand his business into one where he sells spare parts for cars as well as bicycles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles.

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en: Tabita is 28 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by selling onions and tomatoes in a market in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years and is applying for a loan from BRAC and Kiva to buy more onions to sell. She hopes to earn enough money to be able to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and onions to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en: Lois is 45 years old, has five children and earns a living by selling beer in a local market in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years and is applying for a loan from BRAC and Kiva to buy more beer to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rouguietou

texts.fr: Commerçante, elle vend des sacs, des chaussures et des tissus dans une marchée locale située a proximée d'une ville qui est qui est proche de la capitale du Sénegal. Elle s'active dans ce domaine depuis plus de 5 ans ou elle a une expérience avérée. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son fonds de roulement et d'acheter des marchandises pour la revente. Ce prêt lui servira aussi d'augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui s'accroit de plus en plus durant les vacances. Elle veut aussi faire du profits pour ouvrir un magazin destiné a la vente des produits de bébés.
texts.en: Rouguietou is an experienced trader who has been selling bags, shoes and fabrics in the local market of a town near Dakar for over 5 years. This loan will increase her working capital and enable her to restock her merchandise. This will allow her to meet a growing customer demand, which is especially high during the holidays. She would like to make a decent profit from her business so that she can eventually open a shop selling baby products.

loans.use: to restock on her merchandise.

loans.name: Kimberdaid Group

texts.en: Jadson lives in a town called Gweru. He is 28 years old, married and the father of two children, one of whom is only two weeks old. He makes a living by selling a range of products in the local market, including trousers, radios and items that run on solar energy. The main challenges he faces are lack of money to expand his business and high transportation costs. He will use his portion of this group loan to buy more items to sell to his customers and to pay the balance of the money he owes on his wife's dowry. His goal for the future is to open a chain of stores.

loans.use: to buy clothing, radios and solar-powered items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Modesto Noel

texts.es: Modesto Noel tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 42 años que tiene este medio de vida, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos con Fundación por lo que siente muy feliz de tener un medio de ingreso que sea necesario para su hogar. Tiene 8 hijos y siempre les brindo lo que ellos necesitaban. Las prendas de vestir que realiza son pantalones, trajes, prendas de graduación entre otros. El motivo del crédito es para la compra hilos, telas, tijeras, dedales, entre otros.
texts.en: Modesto Noel has been a tailor for more than 42 years, and this is not the first time he his requesting loans to the Fundación, as he feels very happy about having a way to earn the income he needs for his family. He has 8 children to whom he has always given what they needed. Among the clothes he creates there are trousers, suits and graduation dresses. He is requesting a loan to buy threads, scissors and thimbles among other items.

loans.use: To buy threads, scissors and thimbles.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda.She is married with 5 children who all go to school. Margaret sells matooke (steamed green banana) from home on aretail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 7 years. Margaret has requested a loan of 50000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspirations are to build rental houses and educate her children to university level and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation of bunches of bananas. Margaret lives in her own house but the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches  of bananas

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Mme Yacine est commerçante de profession, elle Habite dans une ville du Sénégal, depuis le bas âge elle pratique l'exerce l'activité de commerce et gère une boutique au niveau du marché. du commerce depuis son plus jeune age et s'active sur ce domaine pour renforcer son capital; Elle sollicite un prêt de 200000 pour renforcer le fond de roulement de son activité de commerce. Le financement sera destiné a l'achat de denrées alimentaires (riz, tomate, huiles, laits). Son objectif est de renforcer le stock de produit qu'elle commerciale et d'améliorer le niveau de ses bénéfice. Accroissement de ses revenus lui permettront d'être autonome financièrement et d'aider son mari a prendre en charge les besoins financiers de la famille.
texts.en: Yacine is a trader who lives in a town near Dakar, the capital of Senegal. Since a very young age she works as a trader and manages a store in the local market. She is seeking a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to reinforce her working capital for her store. The loan will be used to buy food products (rice, tomatoes, oil, milk). Her objective is to add to her stock of products that she sells and to improve her profits. Making more revenue will allow her to be financially independent and to help her husband meet the family's financial needs.

loans.use: to buy rice, tomatoes, oil and milk to sell

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: Juana Del Rosario tiene 27 años, su actividad es una pequeña pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, pues como toda madre responsable siempre está brindándoles la mejor atención a sus hijos. Ella compra sus productos en el mercado en donde los obtiene mucho más favorables. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados, entre otros.
texts.en: Juana Del Rosario is 27 years old and she has been running a small corner shop for more than 8 years. She has 2 children who are minor and she is responsible for them like every good mother, always providing them with the best care. She buys her products in the market, obtaining them at very fair prices. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sweets, basic grains, detergents, soups and canned food among other items.

loans.use: To buy sweets, basic grains, detergents and soups.

loans.name: Denge

texts.en:
Denge is married to a housewife. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past four years, Denge has operated a boda boda(motorcycle) business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge in the  high cost of purchasing fuel. Denge dreams of purchasing another motorcycle in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 Denge wants to add on his savings to purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To add to his savings to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Chikophe

texts.en:
Chikophe is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past three years, Chikophe has operated a bO. bO. (motorcycle) business, operating from home to the market. He faces a major challenge of competition from other motorcycle operators in the area. He dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 Chikophe wants to add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Katumu

texts.en: This is 38 year-old Katumu.  She is married, and has 3 children, ages 12, 6 and 3. She has 3 additional dependents, her sisters, who live with her.  In 2000, Katumu established her imported foodstuffs business. She began her business because she wanted to be self employed and to get income to help her husband provide livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 901,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Katumu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more foodstuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Katumu plans to move to a shop and increase her stock. The previous loan has helped her greatly to take care of her family and other needs.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for a variety of imported foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothing and footwear to sell to his customers.

loans.name: 2184 Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
Ferdinant, 26 years old and single, is the president of a group which is called "Duterimbere" in the local language. The group is composed of five people: two men and three women; Ferdinant is the first person on the left in the photo. For five years, he has been selling African clothes, working from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. everyday, with two employees for assist him with sales.

Ferdinant and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more African clothes to sell. With the resulting profit, they will be able to save for the future and expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase more African clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 47-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children. Fifteen years ago, he started working in repairing electricA. devices and equipment. After gaining the needed experience, he opened his own shop in 2004. He welcomes customers who ask only for electronics repairs. With his requested loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will be able to purchase tools and supplies. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en:
Sanyu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children who both go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop, working seven days a week. She has been in business for the last nine years. 

She has requested a loan of from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, rice, cooking oil, salt, and soap. Her major challenges include the ever-increasing prices of commodities and transportation. Her goal is to build a rental houses, own a wholesale house, and educate her children to university level. 

She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, salt, and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits and shorts among other items of clothing.

loans.name: Jorge Alejandro

texts.es: Jorge Alejandro tiene su negocio que es la pesca artesanal. Hace más de 6 años que Jorge es el encargado de su propia actividad. Inicio desde muy joven pues trabajaba como ayudante en botes pesqueros, fue así que el ahorro en ciertas ganancias y logro compra su propio bote. Él tiene 9 hijos de los cuales solamente 3 están bajo su cargo, y con esfuerzo de su trabajo los ha sacado adelante. El crédito es para la ecompra de motor y combustible.
texts.en: Jorge Alejandro has an artisan fishing business which he has been running for over six years.  When he was very young he used to work as a fishing boat assistant and was able to save enough money to buy his own boat.  He has nine children three of which are still in his care.  Through his work he has been able to support his family.  The loan he is requesting is to buy a motor and fuel.

loans.use: To buy a motor and fuel.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 36 years old and is married with five children aged between 5 and 14 years old. She also takes care of two relatives. Her business is well-organized and is well known as a shop that sells various shoes, such as those for seniors and children. Her business hours are from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day and she currently employs two persons to help her. 

Speciose has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more senior's and children's shoes. Any profits will be reinvested in her business and saved for her future. Speciose hopes also to buy three motorcycles to help her in the future with her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more senior's and children's shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has four children aged fifteen, nine, five and three. She has three additional dependents, who live with her because she assists them with their schooling. 

In 1997, Kadiatu established her imported foodstuffs business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more inventory. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open her business in other areas in the town. The loan has helped her to provide livelihoods for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more imported foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es: Jannet, D. 37 años, está casada con Valerio, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 D. ellos, a los que educa y cría en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad D. San Pedro D. Cajas. DesD. que era niña, sus padres le enseñaron el hermoso oficio del tejido hecho artesanalmente, desD. ese entonces hasta el día D. hoy se convirtió en su principal pasatiempo y forma D. trabajo. Ya tiene 4 años D. experiencia, tiempo suficiente para abrir una pequeña tienda donD. venD. prendas, como: boinas (especie D. gorra), chompas, ponchos y chalinas D. toda variedad. Según cuenta, todos los meses D. febrero, julio y octubre; los turistas visitan el “comercial artesanal”, donD. se encuentra la tienda D. Jannet, ahí obtiene buenas ganancias por la demanda que tiene.  Además hace poco incursionó en la venta D. ropa D. bebe, como colchas, frazadas; asimismo chompas para adultos en la ciudad D. Oroya, donD. viaja los días lunes y jueves.  Ahora su principal objetivo es incrementar su capital D. trabajo, para poder invertirlo en su tienda D. artesanía. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Talarmachay” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. espera del apoyo D. todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas.  Jannet D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. chompas D. toda variedad, así como la compra D. ropa D. bebé para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jannet, 37, is married to Valerio and they have four children, two of which still live at home.  They live in their own house in the town of San Pedro D. Cajas.  Ever since she was a little girl she learned from her parents the beautiful craft of hand-knits.  Since then she has turned it into her main pastime and means of income.  She has four years' experience in her small shop where she sells a wiD. variety of garments such as caps, sweaters, ponchos and shawls.  

She says that in the months of February, July and October the tourists visit the "comercial artesanal" (crafts shopping center) where Jannet's shop is located.  She earns a good profit from the high demand.  Also, not too long ago, she began selling infant clothing, bedspreads and blankets, as well as adult sweaters in the city of Oroya where she travels Monday through Thursday.  Now her main goal is to increase her work capital to invest in her craft shop.  She belongs to the communal bank "Talarmachay" and this is her sixth loan through MFP.  She hopes she can count on your support to carry out her goals and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Jannet will use the loan to buy a variety of sweaters and infant clothing.

loans.use: To buy a variety of sweaters and infant .

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Manuel tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos.

Él es un hombre trabajador, que desde la edad de 13 años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura con su padrastro, ya que eran de escasos recursos económicos no pudo asistir a la escuela sino que le toco empezar a trabajar en el cultivo de maíz.

Don Manuel tiene que caminar durante 15 minutos a la orilla de un rió, para llegar a la carretera principal y abordar un carro en donde viaja en la palangana de este durante 45 minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad donde compra los insumos que necesita para realizar sus cultivos.

Él esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo para, comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar una manzana de maíz. Don Manuel con su producción venderá una parte obteniendo los ingresos necesarios, para pagar el préstamo y el resto lo ahorrara, la otra parte de la cosecha la almacenara para la alimentación de su familia. Con esto él estaría ahorrando, ya que los productos de la canasta básica son altos y estaría asegurando la alimentación de su familia.

El sueño de don Manuel es, ahorrar para construirles a sus hijos una casa de ladrillo, por que la que tienen es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Manuel is 34 and lives with his common-law partner and three children.

He is a hard worker who at age 13 began working in agriculture with his step-father.  They had little income so he was not able to go to school but he did begin growing corn.

Manuel must walk 15 minutes every day along the riverbank to get to the main road where he boards a vehicle that will take him along the highway for 45 minutes to the city where he buys supplies for his crops.

He is requesting a loan through the Fundación Campo to buy what he needs to plant corn.  Manuel will sell part of his produce to obtain the funds necesary to pay back the loan and the rest will be saved.  The other part of the harvest will be stored for family consumption.  This means he will be saving money because the price of staple goods is high and he will be able to feed his family.

Dom Manuel's dream is to save enough to build a brick house for his children.  The one they have now is made of "bahareque" ( wattle and daub).

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to plant corn.

loans.name: Damaris Lizeth

texts.es: Damaris Lizeth tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, anteriormente Damaris trabajaba como empleada doméstica y con la ayuda de su esposo junto decidieron ahorrar y comenzar este negocio, con el paso el tiempo ella logro obtener a sus clientes pues siempre le preocupa el brindarle una buena atención a sus clientes. El crédito es para la compra de bolsos, perfumes, billeteras, calzado, reloj y ropa en general.
texts.en: Damaris Lizeth, 38, has her own business selling general goods.  She has been in business for over five years.  Previously, she worked as a domestic employee but with her husband's help was able to save enough to start her business.  She has gained customers by giving them good service.  She plans to use the loan to buy bags, perfumes, billfolds, shoes, watches and clothing in general.

loans.use: To buy bags, , billfolds, , watches and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, de 56 años, se separó de su esposa hace 11 años. Pese a ello, se siente feliz de apoyar a sus 3 hijos, a quienes educa y cría en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Desde niño se dedica a la artesanía y según afirma es el oficio que más ejerce en todos sus ámbitos. Pues realiza diversas técnicas del arte, como pintura en óleo y esculturas de piedra; por ello sus compañeros lo llaman el “múltiple”, ya que es: artesano, escultor, pintor; asimismo es agricultor y ganadero. Según menciona, ya tiene 21 años dedicándose a ello. Sus principales tejidos constan de tapices cuyos dibujos son principalmente de motivos paisajísticos. También elabora artesanía como, cucharones de madera, Huislash (esculturas) y ahora está incursionando en la creación de chalinas de lana de oveja, donde está teniendo gran éxito Por ello desde hace algún tiempo está tramitando los papeles necesarios para poder formalizar una empresa textil, donde pueda exportar y llevar más cantidad de sus productos, a las diferentes ferias del país. Sabe que es un camino largo, pero trabajará con ahínco por su sueño. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Telarmachay” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde incita el respeto entre los integrantes; pues es fundador de su banco comunal y se siente orgulloso de ello. Razón por la que paga su cuota de manera puntual. Mario de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 100 kilos de hilados de oveja que cuestan un promedio de S/. 25 soles por kilo.
texts.en: Mario, 56, has been separated from his wife for 11 years.  But he is happy to be able to support his three children who he educates and raises in their own house in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  Ever since he was a boy he has been involved in handicrafts and says it is what he enjoys most in every regard.  He works with different art techniques such as oil painting and stone sculptures.  That's why his colleagues call him "multiple", because he is: a craftsman, sculptor, painter and even a farmer.  He claims he has been doing this for 21 years.  His main woven products are tapestries depicting landscapes.  He also makes wooden spoons, Huislash (sculptures) and now is going into the line of sheep's wool shawls, which is quite successful.  For a while now he has been processing the required paperwork to set up a textile company so he can export his products and take them around to different fairs in the country.  He knows it will be a long road but he will work hard for his dream.  He belongs to the communal bank "Telarmachay" and this is his seventh loan through MFP.  He is respected by the members there since he is the founder of the bank, and very proud of it.  He is punctual about paying back the loans.  He plans to use the loan to buy 100 kilos of sheep's wool which costs an average 0.25 PEN per kilo.

loans.use: To buy 100 kilos of sheep's wool.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
MERCEDES JUANA ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO "MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS" DESD. HACE DOS AÑOS, TIENE 54 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS, GRACIAS AL TRABAJO QUE ELLA REALIZA COMO MODISTA PUED. APORTAR LA MITAD D. LOS PAGOS D. LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES.
HACE 20 AÑOS  SE INICIÓ COMO MODISTA A CONSECUENCIA QUE SU ESPOSO FUE DESPEDIDO D. LA EMPRESA EN LA QUE TRABAJABA, POR ESTE MOTIVO ELLA EMPIEZA A OFRECER SUS SERVICIOS D. MODISTA A SUS VECINOS, AMIGOS Y FAMILIARES, POSTERIORMENTE LLEGA A ALQUILAR UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO CAQUETA, UN CENTRO COMERCIAL D. MUCHA CONCURRENCIA.
GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO ELLA CONSIDERA QUE HA LOGRADO REALIZARSE COMO PERSONA, ES INDEPENDIENTE Y HA LOGRADO ADQUIRIR SUS MÁQUINAS Y MATERIALES PARA REALIZAR SUS TRABAJOS SIN NINGUN PROBLEMA.
UNA D. SUS METAS ES CRECER COMO EMPRESA Y LUEGO EXPORTAR SUS PRENDAS D. VESTIR.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. MATERIALES NECESARIOS PARA CUMPLIR CON PEDIDOS Y EMPEZAR LA CONFECCION D. PRENDAS PARA LA CAMPAÑA NAVID.ÑA.

NOTA: EN LA FOTO OBSERVAMOS  QUE HAY OCHO PERSONAL, UNA D. LAS CUALES  ACOMPAÑA A UNA D. LAS INTEGRANTES PORTAL NO ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO (VISTE D. PANTALÓN JEANS MORADO).
texts.en:
Mercedes has been a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras for 2 years. She is 54 years old, married and has 3 children. Thanks to her work as a dressmaker she can contribute half of the household expenses.

Twenty years ago her husband lost his job and as a result of that she began to offer her services as a dressmaker to the neighbors, friends, and relatives. Then later she decided to rent a place in the Caqueta Mercado, a commercial center with a lot of activity. 

Thanks to her work she believes she is now an independent person, and she has been able to get the machines and material to do her work without a problem.

One of her goals is to grow as a company and then later export her clothing. She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of the necessary supplies to complete her orders and to begin making clothes for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase materials for delivery of clothing orders

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión, tiene 63 años, es socia del FINCA Peru desde hace mas de 13 años.
Justina tiene una tienda en su propia casa, con mucho esfuerzo pudo hacer surgir esta tienda con la ayuda de los préstamos recibidos, gracias a ello pudo terminar de construir su casa y educar a sus hijos, las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal le ayudaron a poder formar su negocio y ser mas responsable y constante, pudo comprarse un carro y construir parte de su casa que ahora alquila, recuerda que su primer crédito lo utilizo para poder comprar azúcar y arroz pero poquito, ahora su tienda ha mejorado mucho. el préstamo que recibirá lo utilizará para construir otra parte de su casa y poder alquilar.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the communal bank Unión. She is 63 years old, and has been working with FINCA Peru for more than 13 years.

She has a store in her own house, and through her efforts her store has grown. The loans helped her finish the construction of her house and to educate her children. The training she received through the communal bank helped her to start her business, and to be responsible and reliable. She was able to buy a car and construct part of her house which she now rents. She remembers that her first loan enabled her to buy a little bit of sugar and rice. Now her store has greatly improved. 

The loan she is now asking for will be used to build an addition to her house to be used for rental.

loans.use: to purchase materials to be used for an addition to her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Elsa Carmen

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal Unión, tiene 56 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 15 años.
Elsa tiene una casa de 4 pisos que alquila, a parte tambien vende hielo y cosméticos, recuerda con mucho cariño que Finca le ayudó a poder comprar su terreno y poco a poco pudo construir su casa, esta muy agradecida ya que le ayudaron y le enseñaron a poder ser responsable y además de muchos valores, con las capacitaciones aprendió como hacer y como hacer crecer su negocio. El préstamo que recibirá lo invertirá en la construcción de los cuartos del 4 piso, y ahora su meta es poder ahorrar para la titulación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank Unión. She is 56 years old with 2 children, and has been working with FINCA Peru for 15 years. 

Elsa rents out rooms in her 4-story house. She also sells ice and cosmetics. She remembers fondly how FINCA helped her to buy her land and little by little to build her house. She is grateful for the help she received and that they taught her to be responsible and to have higher ethics. The training taught her how to conduct and grow her business. 

The loan that she is asking for will be used to add rooms to the 4th floor. Her goal is to save for her child to receive qualifications.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the construction of rooms in her house

loans.name: Claudia Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Josefina esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a mejorar el local donde tiene su negocio. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar equipo de trabajo que es (secadora de pelo, maquina para cortar el cabello, plancha de pelo y para los tintes) ya que fue victima de un robo y se llevaron toda su herramienta de trabajo. 
Doña Claudia Josefina planea pagar el crédito con una parte de sus ganancias ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia y poder darles los estudios necesarios a sus dos hijos, que tiene bajo su responsabilidad, ya que es madre soltera. 
Desea mejor su negocio y que tenga más ingresos y así poder darles la mejor educación y vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is grateful for assistance and she asked for this loan because it will help her improve the place where she does business, and to be able to buy work equipment such as hair dryers, shears for cutting hair, hair straightener, and hair dyes. 

She was a victim of a robbery and they stole her work tools.

Claudia will repay the loan from her profits, which is how she provides for her family including the cost of educating her 2 sons, as she bears this responsibility as a single mother. 

She wants to improve her business and increase her earnings to be able to give her children the best education and life that she can.

loans.use: to purchase tools of the trade for her beauty salon

loans.name: Faty

texts.fr:
Mariée mère de 7 enfants, Faty est âgée de 42 ans, et vie dans une famille polygame  avec son époux sa coépouse  et leurs enfants dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Pour des raisons sociales, Faty n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études, pour cela elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour la vente des bois de construction depuis maintenant 15 ans. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et  augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 6 ans. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 10 prêts dans l’association (prêt de groupe) tous payé sans difficulté  et est à son 3 eme prêt individuel dont les deux précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 2 chargements de bois de construction dans un  village de Koutiala, et effectue sa vente  devant sa porte  à une clientèle  de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts,  participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of seven children, Faty is 42 years old and lives in a polygamous family with her spouse, her co-spouse, and their children in the town of Koutiala. 

For socio-economic reasons, Faty did not have the good fortune to attend school and for that reason she got into money-generating activities at a young age. After having tried several activities without success, she opted in the end for selling construction wood, which she has been doing for 15 years now. 

In order to satisfy the needs of her clientele as to quantity and to grow her business, she decided to turn to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso six years ago. She has already received 10 loans with her association (group loans), all repaid without problems, and is on her third individual loan with the two preceding individual loans correctly reimbursed. 
 
With this loan she expects to buy two loads of construction wood in a village near Koutiala and plans to sell her wood in front of her door, to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash or credit. 
 
She expects to make an average profit of 100,000 F CFA each month which she plans to use to reimburse the interest, participate in covering daily expenses for the family, and invest the rest in other money-earning undertakings.

loans.use: to buy construction wood.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel tiene su negocio que es ebanistería y carpintería, él tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio son 8 años que Leonel tiene en este negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre se encuentran satisfechos con este tipo de negocios, inicio trabajando como ayudante en un taller y cuando aprendió el oficio emigrando a Costa Rica fue aquí que aprendió este tipo de negocio y decidió establecer el propio. El crédito es para la compra madera, cepillos, pega, serruchos, entre otros
texts.en:
Leonel has a woodwork and carpentry business. He has a lot of experience in this work because he has been doing it for 8 years. Most of his clients are always pleased with his handicraft. 

He first started working as an assistant in a carpenter’s shop and after learning the trade he migrated to Costa Rica and this is where he learned this type of business and decided to start his own. 

This loan is to buy wood, brushes, glue, saws and other things.

loans.use: to buy wood, brushes, glue, saws and other supplies

loans.name: Katina Sarita

texts.es:
Katina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión, tiene 36 años, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 5 años.
Katina tiene un locutorio y vende tarjetas telefónicas, empezó vendiendo queso por menor y mayor de ahí fue creciendo con sus ahorros, en las capacitaciones le enseñaron muchos valores y a poder ahorrar ya que en la casa no se puede, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando va a comprar mas tarjetas y recargas para su negocio. Su meta es seguir esforzándose y progresar.
texts.en:
Katina is a member of the communal bank Unión. She is 36 years old and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 5 years. 

Katina has a communications call center and sells phone cards. She began by selling cheese, in small amounts and bulk, and from there her savings grew. During training they taught her business ethics and she was able to save, which she could not do by staying at home.

Now she is asking for a loan to buy more telephone cards and recharges for her business. Her goal is to continue her efforts and to progress.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1980 à Ségou, Idrissa est marié à une épouse, père d’un enfant et vit chez son père dans une famille traditionnelle dans la ville de koutiala.  
Idrissa, avec le décès de son frère qui aidait son père à gérer la pharmacie familiale, quitté Soro Yiriwaso(où il était en stage) pour remplacer son frère défunt à la pharmacie. Comme les médicaments font parties des besoins de première nécessité, il est très sollicité par ses clients et sa notoriété est bonne. 
Pour augmenter  son stock de produits, il décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans.  Il est à son 3 eme prêt individuel  et les deux précédents  ont été bien payés. 
Monsieur Idrissa envisage de se constituer un important stock en achetant différents produits pharmaceutiques (médicaments) avec ce prêt. Il s’approvisionne  auprès des grands pharmaciens de Bamako et souvent à   Koutiala  si la commande n’est pas importante. Il  vend tout les jours  sa pharmacie au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant et quelques rare fois à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 225.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt et investir le reste dans son activités de revenus.
texts.en:
Born around 1980 in Ségou, Idrissa is married to one wife, father of one child, and lives with his father in a traditional family in the town of Koutiala. 

On the death of his brother, who was helping his father to manage the family pharmacy, Idrissa left Soro Yiriwaso (where he was involved in training) to replace his late brother in the pharmacy. Since medicines are absolute necessities, he is much in demand with his customers and he has a good reputation. 

To grow his stock of products, he decided, two years ago, to turn to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  He is on his third individual loan and the two preceding ones were correctly repaid.  

Monsieur Idrissa plans to put together a big stock by buying different pharmaceutical products (medicines) with this loan. He buys his goods from the important pharmacists in Bamako and often in Koutiala if it is not a big order. He sells daily in his pharmacy at the big open-air market of Koutiala to a clientele composed of women and men, for cash and very rarely on credit. 

He expects to make a monthly profit of 225,000 F CFA which he expects to use to reimburse the loan as it comes due, investing the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra María tiene 34 años, su actividad es una pulpería en donde atiende a sus clientes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. A pesar de ser una comarca muy pequeña ella ha logrado brindar a sus clientes los productos que le solicitan como granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, papel higiénico, fósforos, cigarrillos, golosinas entre otros. Es por eso que se siente motivada a realizar este crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is 34 years old. She has a small grocery store where she takes care of customers from 7:00AM in the morning until 10:00PM at night. 

Despite being a very small area she has been able to provide her customers with what they want, such as basic grains, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, cigarettes, candy and other items, and this is what motivates her to ask for a loan in order to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, cigarettes, and candy

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Manuel tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, sus dos hijos y su mamá.

Don Manuel es un hombre, que se esfuerza día a día para salir adelante con su familia, desde la edad de 10 años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura con su papá. Él se levanta todos los días a las 5:00 de la mañana para empezar su jornada laboral en la agricultura. 

Él debe viajar a la ciudad más cercana, en busca de los insumos agrícolas necesarios, debe viajar durante 30 minutos en la palangana de un carro desde su comunidad hasta la ciudad.

Él tiene mucha experiencia en la siembra de maíz por lo que actualmente, esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo para, comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar dos manzanas de maíz. Don Manuel con su producción venderá una parte obteniendo los ingresos necesarios, para cubrir las necesidades del hogar y la otra parte la almacenara, para la alimentación de su familia. Así estaría asegurando la alimentación de su familia y obteniendo ingresos que seran utilizados en satisfacer otras necesidades del hogar.

El sueño de don Manuel es, ahorrar para construir  una casa de ladrillo, por que la que tienen es de bahareque y ahí viven sus hijos su esposa y su mamá. Por eso él trabaja muy fuerte para lograr su sueño y esta seguro que a través del préstamo lo conseguirá.
texts.en:
Manuel is 36 years old. He lives with his partner for life, his 2 children, and his mother. 

Manual is a man who tries every day to provide for his family. He began to work in farming with his father when he was 10 years old. He wakes up every day 5:00AM in the morning to begin his daily work in agriculture.

He has to go to a nearby city to buy agriculture supplies that he needs, traveling 30 minutes in the back of a pickup truck from his community to the city.

He has a lot of experience in the growing of corn and now is asking for a loan from Fundacion Campo, in order to buy what he needs to be able to plant 2 rectangular blocks of corn. He will sell some of what he grows to cover household expenses and he will store some in order to feed his family. In this way he will be sure that his family has food on the table and income to meet household expenses. 

Manuel’s dream is to save for a brick house, because now they have a home with mud walls and he lives there with his children, wife, and mother. This is why he works so hard to achieve his dream and he is sure that through this loan he will reach it.

loans.use: to buy the supplies he needs to plant corn

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Unión, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 6 años. 
Maximiliana tiene una tienda de venta de computadoras y accesorios, repuestos de computadoras, antes trabajaba en la agricultura, y nunca había trabajado con ninguna entidad financiera porque no confiaba, una amiga le invitó a ser socia del Banco Comunal, le encanta porque hizo buenas amigas y también pudo aprender mucho acerca de cómo hacer empresa y como ahorrar, esa misma educación que ella recibe en Finca lo ha podido transmitir a sus hijos, el préstamo que solicita lo utilizará para poder invertir en la compra de impresoras y laptop.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the communal bank Unión. She is 43 years old and has 3 children. She has been a member on FINCA Perú for 6 years. 

Maximiliana has a store where she sells computers and accessories, and computer parts. She used to work in agriculture and she had never worked with a financial institution because she didn’t trust them. A friend invited her to be a member of the communal bank and she loves it because she made good friends and also because she could learn so much about being in business and how to save. She is teaching her children what she learns from FINCA. 

She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of printers and a laptop.

loans.use: to buy printers and a laptop

loans.name: Flerida Emperatriz

texts.es:
Flerida Emperatriz tiene 39 años de edad no tiene hijos  es soltera vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de  Bolívar.

La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, esta conformada por quince integrantes y está ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, Soya plátano, naranja, etc.

Flerida  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de cacao arroz, maíz, soya, naranja, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos e insumos para los cultivos y también invertir en la compra de cerdos para la cría y luego venderlos. 

Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas. 

El sueño es poderse comprar una casa para poder vivir tranquilos sin preocuparse de los arriendos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los padres.
texts.en:
Flerida is 39 years old, single with no children, and lives with her parents in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. 

The VCR Unión y Progreso la Colombia has 15 members and is located 90 minutes from the cooperative in San Jose. This area is known for agricultural activities such as the growing of cocoa, rice, corn, soy, bananas, and oranges. 

Flerida works in agriculture planting cocoa, rice, corn, soy, and oranges, and the purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo every weekend. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers and supplies for crops and to buy pigs for breeding for later resale. The loan will help her meet her financial needs. 

She faces the normal challenges of competition and pests. 

Her dream is to be able to buy a house in order to live peacefully without worrying about rent. In her free time she likes to go on walks with her parents.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and supplies for crops and to buy pigs for breeding

loans.name: Ramon Isidoro

texts.es:
Ramón Isidoro tiene 43 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con un hermano en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, está conformada por quince integrantes y está ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, Soya plátano, naranja, etc.

Ramón  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de cacao arroz, maíz, soya, naranja, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos e insumos para los cultivos y también invertir en la compra de cerdos para la cría y luego venderlos. 

Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas.
