She has gained many clients, as the service she provides is excellent, offering the best haircuts, styling, and straightening. Her merchandise is also of very good quality and reasonably priced. Gladis is an entrepreneurial woman who takes life's daily challenges head on. That's why she's taking out this loan with Apoyo Integral [Kiva field partner] to buy cosmetics, creams, shampoos, and conditioners, among other products, that she lacks to meet her clients' requests. Gladis Noemí is confident that this is how she will succeed in providing her family with economic security and a better life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams, shampoos, and conditioners, among other products.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Déboras Group

texts.es:
Doña Karla es la Tesorera de Banco Mujer Las Déboras, con 33 años de edad madre sola, jefa de hogar, vive con sus 4 hijos todos menores de edad, estudiantes de primaria y secundaria.  Se enteró de los servicios de Fundación Mujer por medio de unas encuestas realizadas en la zona de Siquirres, y está es la primera solicitud de crédito de este grupo.  

Ella se dedica a la elaboración pan, empanadas y otros productos de panadería, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura, queso y más insumos para la elaboración de sus productos. 
Ella empezó a vender pan para obtener ingresos económicos para ella y su familia, y los principales obstáculos que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de dinero para comprar materia prima, así como la de un vehículo para transportar sus productos. 
El día de Karla empieza muy temprano para poder hacer todo el pan, entregarlo temprano, y luego se dedica a sus labores domésticas, y cuidar de sus hijas pequeñas. 
El sueño de Karla es tener su propia panadería en el centro de la cuidad donde vive, y no tener que hacerlo en su casa. El crédito va ser de gran ayuda para ella y sus 6 compañeras del grupo que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y de pequeña industria.
texts.en:
Karla is Treasurer of the Las Déboras Women's Bank group. She is 33 years old, the head of her household, and lives with her four children who are in elementary and high school. She signed up with Fundación Mujer [Kiva field partner] through some interviews in the Siquierres area and this is her first loan with this group. 

Karla bakes bread, empanadas, and other baked goods and with this loan she will purchase flour, butter, sugar, yeast, cheese, and other supplies for her baking. She started selling bread to earn some money for herself and her family. Her main obstacles have been the lack of money to buy primary ingredients, as well as the lack of a car to transport her products. Karla's days begin very early so she can bake her bread and distribute it. After that, takes care of household work and cares for her young daughters. 

Karla's dream is to own her own bakery downtown in her city, rather than work out of her house. This loan will be a great help to her and her six fellow group members, who will also invest in retail and small businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia D. cincuenta y uno años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos dentro D. una comunidad al norte del país y muy cerca a la capital. Ella posee un taller D. costura, donD. confecciona todo tipo D. ropa, faldas, camisas, vestidos, para damas, caballeros y niños al gusto del cliente, el lugar del negocio es muy estratégico y se ha hecho D. mucha clientela en los últimos 10 años, pues su trabajo es D. mucha calidad y tiene precios accesibles; el servicio es excelente; para Herminia la vida es una oportunidad diaria y quiere aprovecharla al máximo, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas por mayor, hilos, agujas entre otros que permitan reducir sus costos y poder adquirir mayores margenes D. ganancias. Herminia tiene la esperanza  que con su trabajo podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida
texts.en:
Herminia, at 51 years of age, lives with her life partner and her children in a community in the north of the country, very close to the capital. She has a seamstress shop where she produces all types of clothing, including skirts, shirts, dresses, and women's, men's, and children's clothing on demand. Her business location is very advantageous and she has developed a large clientele over the past 10 years, as her work is of high quality and she offers reasonable prices and excellent service. 

For Herminia, life is a daily opportunity and she likes to make the most of it. That's why she is taking out this loan from Apoyo Integral [Kiva field partner] to buy wholesale clothe, thread, and needles, among other items, that will reduce her costs and allow her to increase her profit margins. Herminia has hope that through her work she will be able to proviD. a higher quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothe, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Yhval's Group

texts.en:
Yhval is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and a daughter. The daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and the sons are working in Russia.  

Yhval works as a cleaner in the local school; she also cultivates fruits and vegetables for making additional money for her livelihood.  She started to cultivate agricultural produce seven years ago with an initial investment of 1000 soms. Selling some part of the harvest, Yhval earns about 3000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase saltpeter for processing the harvest, which hasn’t been collected yet. In the near future Yhval plans to visit Moscow to meet with her sons.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase saltpeter for processing her harvest.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en una localidad muy concurrida de personas. Ella de dedica a la compra de chatarra, plástico y cobre acompañada por su compañero de vida quien maneja el pick up, van de colonia tras colonia pregonando con un altavoz que compran dichos productos y luego los venden a compañias que se encargan de reciclar los mismos y procesarlos en nueva materia prima; además posee tienda y venta de verduras en su residencia que es atendida cuando ella no se encuentra en el lugar por sus hijos que ya colaboran en la actividad productiva del hogar, se ha hecho de muchos clientes pues es toda una mujer comerciante, sabe cómo invertir para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela y para poder obtener mejores ganancias, además de vender productos de buena calidad y tiene precios accesibles;  María es toda una mujer de negocios  siempre se mantiene activa y le da el mejor servicio a las personas; actualmente le ofrecen vender mayor cantidad de chatarra a un precio con el que ella puede obtener una muy buena ganancia y por ello se encuentra solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprarla, además reinvertir en la compra de verduras y productos de primera necesidad para su tienda. María tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor vida para su familia que bien merecido lo tiene con tanto trabajo.
texts.en:
49-year old María lives with her husband and children in a densely populated area. She earns her living buying scrap metal, plastic, and copper. She is accompanied by her husband who drives the pick up truck. They go from village to village using a loud speaker to explain what they buy, and then they sell the items to recycling companies who turn the items into new products. 

In addition María runs a store selling vegetables out of her home. When she is not at home, her children take over since they are all involved in running the household. She has many customers as she is a good businesswoman. She knows what to buy in order to satisfy her customers' needs and earn more money. The products she sells are of good quality and prices, and she provides good service. 

Currently María is being offered the chance to buy more scrap at a low price so she would earn a good profit on it. For this reason she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL to buy the scrap. She would use her earnings to buy more vegetables and staples for her store. María is confident that she will succeed in providing a steady income and a better life for her family who greatly deserve it.

loans.use:
Comprar chatarra, plásticos, cobre, verduras y productos de tienda
to buy scrap metal, plastic, copper, vegetables, and other items for her store

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro del Carmen vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos menores hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, huevos, carnes, lacteos, productos enlatados, entre otros más, su negocio es muy conocido en la localidad pues Milagro siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita con excelente calidad de productos y a muy buenos precios; su tienda es la más surtida del lugar, además les dá el mejor servicio siempre recibe a las personas con una gran sonrisa en el rostro esperando poder atenderlos de la mejor manera; Milagro piensa que dentro de las personas esta la capacidad de manifestar los sueños, y ella quiere manifestar y cumplir sus sueños de ver crecer el negocio, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos con los que no cuenta y demandan sus clientes, como: medicina, cosméticos, bebidas dulces, productos instantáneos, jabón, entre otros. De esta forma Milagro del Carmen espera no decir "no hay" en su negocio y vender todo lo posible para conservar sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias que siempre den el sustento diario a su familia para al final mejorar la calidad de sus vidas
texts.en:
Milagro del Carmen lives with her common-law husband and their two minor children in their own house.  She runs a store where she sells daily consumption items such as staples, eggs, meat, dairy products, canned goods and others.  Her business is well-known in the town because Milagro stocks everything a customer could ever need in the way of excellent products at good prices.  Her store has the best inventory around and she gives the best customer service, always greeting people with a big smile on her face and wanting to help in any way she can.

Milagro believes that each person has the capacity to manifest his or her dreams.  Her dream is to grow her business, so she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL which she will use to buy products in most demand by her customers, such as: medicine, cosmetics, sweet drinks, instant products, and soap, among other items.  Milagro del Carmen hopes that she will not have to say "I'm out of that." at her store because she wants to do everything she can to keep her customers and obtainer higher earnings so she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sweets, bread, beverages, instant products, and soap.

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.ru: Неъматулло проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Неъматулло имеет среднее образование. Он предоставляет услугу. Занимается строительными работами по найму. В этой области он уже 11 лет. Кредит просит для приобретения строительных материалов.
texts.en: Nematullo lives in the town of Istaravshan. He is 30 years old, married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker. Nematullo has secondary education. He provides a service, he does construction work for hire. He has been in this business for eleven years already. He is asking for a loan to buy building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Didaikan's Group

texts.en:
Didaikan is the leader of this group. She is 54 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two daughters and two sons. The younger son is  handicapped and the younger daughter works in Russia. The other children are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money to support her livelihood, Didaikan cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. She has been running this business for twenty years. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further resale. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Oscar Alonso

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 22 años de edad y se dedica en pequeña escala al cultivo de cafe y malanga. Oscar a pesar de ser una persona muy joven ha sabido salir adelante por su propio esfuerzo, desde muy pequeño de edad inició a trabajar en una finca de cafe y al pasar los años fue aprendiendo todo lo referente al manejo del cultivo de cafe. Su situacion economica cambio en el momento que se caso ya que su suegro le dio una parcela de tierra para que la trabajara, asi que Oscar empezo a cultivar cafe y actualmente tambien esta sembrando malanga. El no tiene trabajadores que le ayuden asi que el mismo realiza el cuidado de los cultivos y lo hace todos los dias desde muy temprano por las mañanas. Una de sus desventajas es que la region es propicia para este tipo de cultivos y tiene mucha competencia, pero siempre logra vender toda su produccion.

El prestamo que Oscar esta solitando lo necesita para la compra de fertilizantes e ir tecnificando su finca poco a poco. Con el apoyo del prestamo el producto de sus cultivos seran de mayor calidad.

Su meta es aumentar la produccion y darle una vida digna a su familia. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el compromiso de sus pagos de forma puntual para que la Organizacion lo siga apoyando con otros prestamos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 22 and has a small coffee and malanga (edible tropical fruit) plantation.  Although he is very young, Oscar has worked hard to get ahead and from a very early age began working on a coffee plantation where he learned all about growing coffee.  His economic situation changed as soon as he got married since his father-in-law gave him his own patch of land.  Oscar began growing coffee and now also grows malanga.  He has no hired help so he is the only one who cares for the crops, which he does every day from very early in the morning.  One of the disadvantages of the region is that it's very good for this type of crop so there is a lot of competition, but he does manage to sell all of his production.

The loan Oscar is requesting will be used to buy fertilizer and to begin adapting his land technologically little by little.  With the help of the loan his crops will be of better quality.

His goal is to increase production and give his family a better lifestyle.  This is his first term in FAMA and he is committed to paying back the loan on time so the organization will continue helping him with future loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Aigul's Group

texts.en:
Aigul is the leader of this group. She is 37 and married to an entrepreneur. Together with her husband she brings up a son and two daughters. Both daughters are in school and while the son is preschool age (under seven). Aigul works as a nurse with the Red Cross. She runs a cattle breeding business with her husband. They started this activity five years ago with an initial investment of 10000 soms. With the profits gained from reselling cattle, Aigul improved the family’s living conditions. She applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future Aigul wants to expand the business and improve the family’s welfare. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Molek

texts.ru:
Компания «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» выражает искреннюю признательность инвесторам Кива, поддержавших Молек в ее бизнесе.   Выданный кредит на животноводство по линии Кива был выплачен без просрочек. 
Молек родилась в селе Чалдовар (Панфиловский район, Чуйская  обл., Кыргызская Республика). Молек 53 года, вдова. Она воспитывает трех сыновей - старший Сулайман, средний Шамиль и младший сын Султан, они все проживают в с. Ровное, в собственном доме.
Молек  была четвертым  ребенком в многодетной, малообеспеченной семье. С раннего возраста ей пришлось помогать матери по хозяйству, поэтому окончила всего 7 классов средней школы,  продолжить  обучение  не было возможности.  Молек с  ранних лет пошла работать дояркой в колхоз, а после замужества занималась  воспитанием и обучением детей.  Когда умер супруг  Молек, семье пришлось тяжело, дети и она  сильно переживали потерю отца, мужа. Молек стала тянуть лямку за двоих, на ее плечах лежала большая ответственность и она приложила  все усилия для развития бизнеса в животноводстве, начатого вместе с мужем. На  тот  момент у неё в хозяйстве  имелось  15 голов  овец и 1 корова, источником дохода была продажа молока и молочных продуктов. Молек во всем помогали дети,  выгоняя крупнорогатый скот  на  пастбища и параллельно подрабатывая пастухами.  Таким образом, вся семья  занималась животноводством. 
В данный момент  в хозяйстве у Молек имеются 3 дойных коровы, 1 бык, 1 кобыла и 22 головы овцы. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Молек обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овцематок.  В планах у нее – ремонт сарая и  увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: "Bai Tushum and Partners" company expresses a sincere gratitude to Kiva investors, who supported Molek in her business.  Kiva's line of credit, given to Molek for her animal husbandry business, was repaid without delays.  Molek was born in the Chaldovar village (Panfilovsk district, Chuysk region, Kyrgyz republic).  She is 53 years old and a widow.  She is raising three sons - oldest Sulayman, middle Shamil and youngest Sultan, and all of them live in the Rovnoe village, in their own house.  Molek was the fourth child in a large, low-income family.  Since young age, she had to help her mother with the household, and this is why she only completed 7 grades of a secondary school and did not have the opportunity to finish her education.  Also since young age, Molek went to work as a dairymaid at a collective farm and was involved in raising and educating her children after she was married.  When Molek's husband passed away, it was difficult for the family, and the children and she suffered through the loss of their father and husband.  Molek started to pull the strap for two.  She had a large responsibility on her shoulders, and put all of her efforts toward developing the animal husbandry business, that she started together with her husband.  At that moment, she had 15 heads of sheep and one cow, and the sales of milk and dairy products was the source of income.  Molek's children helped her with everything by taking cattle to pasture and working as shepherds parallel to this.  This is how the entire family was involved in animal husbandry.  Currently, Molek's business includes three dairy cows, one bull, one horse and 22 heads of sheep.  To further develop her business, Molek requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company in order to purchase ewes.  She plans to repair her barn and increase livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase ewes

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Акрам житель района Шахринав. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. У него среднее образование. Он более пяти лет занимается животноводством. Кроме того Акрам занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа двух коров.
texts.en: Akram is a resident of the Shahrinav region. He is 36 years old, married and has five children. He has secondary education. He has been doing animal husbandry for more than five years. Also, Akram does agriculture. He has a plot of land by his house where he grows vegetables. He is taking out the loan to buy two cows.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to an entrepreneur. Together they bring up three sons and a daughter. The older son studies at university and other children are in school. The family is engaged in wholesale trade of meat. They started this business is 1996 and since that time Damira together with her husband achieved good results. With the profits gained they were able to build a house. At the moment, Damira applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase two livestock animals for breeding, fattening and further resale. She also plans to purchase feed for livestock. In the future she wishes to purchase a piece of land near to Bishkek to start building a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Sabira's Group

texts.en:
Sabira is the leader of this group. She is 53 and married to a farmer. Sabira has raised four sons and a daughter. The daughter studies at university and the sons are employed. In order to earn money to meet daily needs, the family breeds livestock and cultivates agricultural products. They have been doing this for 19 years. By selling part of the harvest and reselling livestock after fattening, Sabira earns about 5000 soms per month. This profit made her able to pay her daughter’s tuition at university. With money received from the loan Sabira plans to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future she wants to see her daughter get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Tashkomur – a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 30 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and two sons. The older son studies at school and the other children are preschool age (under seven). In 2004, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, the family purchased four livestock animals and since that time they have been breeding livestock for making money to support their livelihood. Nazira applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further resale. In the future, she wants to improve the family’s living conditions with the profits gained from reselling livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.ru: Манучехр проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 22 года. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Манучехр зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Manuchehr lives in the town of Khujand. He is 22 years old. He is married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. Manuchehr makes a living by breeding large horned cattle. He is taking out the loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is a resident and a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya. He is a teacher by profession and has been practicing farming for the the last 11 years. His farm currently produces milk, bananas, coffee and maize all of which go to the local market.

Clement has requested for a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to save the income from farming to enable him buy and build a residential house for his family as well as improve on the quality of dairy cows he rears. 

He is happy with Juhudi Kilimo’s facilitation with farming loans. He however sees poor markets for the farm produce and scarcity of feeds as the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 43 years old, married and has 4 children. Her eldest daughter has completed her education through the 16th standard and is now a school teacher. Her remaining children are also getting their education. 
Nasreen is a housewife, stays at her home and performs her household duties. She is very active and fulfills her responsibilities very well. 
Her husband operates an optical shop in the market. He sells sunglasses and optical glasses to his customers at reasonable rates. He also gives computerized eye testing services to his customers. His customers trust his services and he makes good profits every month. 
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy glasses of different brands to put to his shop for sale. 
He has been operating his business for past many years and Nasreen is confident that an investment will increase his productivity.

loans.use: To buy glasses for her husband's optical shop business

loans.name: Asilbi

texts.ru: Асилби проживает в городе Куляб. Она замужем. Ей 40 лет. У нее четверо детей. Ее сын работает в строительной организации на должности главного бухгалтера. Сама она занимается торговлей на рынке. Имеет торговую точку, где продает фрукты и овощи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки огурцов, помидоров, яблок, винограда, сливы и груши.
texts.en: Asilbi lives in the town of Kulob.  She is 40 years old, married and has four children.  Her son works at a construction organization as the chief accountant.  Asilbi is involved in sales at the market.  She has a retail outlet, where she sells fruits and vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, grapes, plums and pears.

loans.use: to buy cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, grapes, plums and pears

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice is 25 year old married woman with three children, two of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Hai Mahad Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.
Rejoice requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to order more charcoal for sale. She says that the extra income generated from this loan will help her build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдулло житель города Куляб. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Он занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном он занимается торговлей однотонных тканей и материалов. Этим видом деятельности Абдулло занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для закупа байковых и других видов материалов.
texts.en: Abdullo lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 39 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in sales at the market.  He primarily sells single-tone fabrics and materials.  Abdullo has been involved in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of flannel and other types of materials.

loans.use: to buy flannel and other types of materials

loans.name: Mirzo

texts.ru: Мирзо проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам он имеет среднее образование. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает мужскую одежду и обувь. В этой области он 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки осеней обуви.
texts.en: Mirzo lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Mirzo has a secondary education.  He leases a retail outlet, where he sells men's clothing and shoes.  He has been in this business for 10 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fall shoes.

loans.use: to purchase fall shoes

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 28 years old, a married woman but she has no child. She has a business of selling beans and onions in Hai Mahad, Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. She can also earn some income from selling alcohol at home.

Joice requested this loan through BRAC south sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.she says that, the extra income from this loan she will use it for building a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to able her to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Kulgaaky

texts.ru:
Компания «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» выражает искреннюю признательность Кива инвесторам за поддержку и финансирование первого кредита Кулгаакы по линии Кива, который был выплачен без просрочек. 
Кулгаакы  47 лет, замужем и имеет двух детей.  Кулгаакы работает учителем английского языка в местной школе, а также преподает в университете и известна как ответственный, честный и принципиальный человек.  В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Кулгаакы занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Семейный бизнес в разведении скота и выращивании фасоли, в ведении которого ей помогает муж,  приносит Кулгаакы около 9,000 сом ежемесячно.    Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулгаакы обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушу м и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом на покупку коровы и оплаты сбора урожая фасоли.  Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на покупку строй материалов для постройки ограждения.
texts.en: "Bai Tushum and Partners" company expresses a sincere gratitude to Kiva investors, who supported and financed Kulgaaky's first loan through Kiva, which was repaid without delays.  Kulgaaky is 47 years old, married and has two children.  She works as an English language teacher at the local school and also teaches at a university.  She is known as a responsible, honest and principled person.  As a secondary income for her family, Kulgaaky is involved in animal husbandry and farming.  The family business of breeding livestock and growing beans, with which her husband helps, yields Kulgaaky about 9,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Kulgaaky requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a cow and pay for beans harvest gathering.  She plans to use the profits from the loan to buy construction materials to build a fence.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and pay for harvest gathering

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 39 years old and a married woman with five children. One of her children is in school. She has a business of selling beer in the Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Lucy requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the profits generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a mother of 4 and a farmer in her native home in Nkubu, Central Kenya where she produces potatoes, bananas and cabbages for the local market. Two of her children are still schooling and she fully relies on farming for her family upkeep. She has been in farming for 24 years and is aged 47.

Doris has requested for a loan of 47,250 KES to enable her venture in dairy farming. She says she wants to start dairy farming so as to supplement her family meals and earn income to educate her children. She has focus on starting a retail shop dealing in cereals.

She laments of high prices for farm inputs. She however appreciates Juhudi Kilimo’s intervention on farmers financial needs.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married. He lives with his wife and his five children.

Thaer is an owner of a photography studio since 2006, with a part of the studio for photocopier and some stationery. He gained the experience with practice for more than six years. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot customers passing by.

He decided to apply for $2000 loan in order to pay the annual rent of his studio and to add more goods. He is aiming to increase profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent of his studio and to add more goods.

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда жительница района Пяндж. Ей 42 года. Она вдова. У нее пятеро детей. Ее отец занимается торговлей. Сама Мавчуда занимается торговлей салатов. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 12 лет. Целью получения кредита является покупка продуктов для приготовления салатов.
texts.en: Mavchuda lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 42 years old, a widow and has five children.  Her father is involved in sales.  Mavchuda is involved in selling salads.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  The goal of this loan is to purchase products for preparing salads.

loans.use: to purchase products needed for preparing salads

loans.name: Kelementina

texts.en:
Kelementina is a 50 year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling simsim and beans in the Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for ten years.

Kelementina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more simsim, beans and onions for sale

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, a 52-year-old single woman living with her family in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, has been operating a motorcycle transport business to earn a living for five years now. The service, called habal-habal, consists of a single motorcycle that carries two to six passengers, and can be seen most frequently in rural and remote areas with significant slopes to bypass.

Earning approximately PHP 8,000 each month, Alma, who joined the cooperative this year, is now requesting her second loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase motor accessories to give better service to passengers. In the future, she hopes to extend her service's seating capacity to earn more income and to provide her passengers with a more comfortable ride.

loans.use: to purchase motor accessories to give better service to passengers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth is 31 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two school-aged children. 

Jeaneth has engaged in a motorcycle transport business to make a living. She owns the vehicle and it is operated personally by her husband so as to fully receive the income in each day of work. Everyday needs of the household are primarily taken from this income. She has had this business for two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. She has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 10,000 to purchase motor tires and spare parts.

Jeaneth is a new member of the cooperative, having initially borrowed the above mentioned amount. Jeaneth hopes to resume the business operations immediately to cover the day-to-day needs of the family. She plans to widen the seating capacity to accommodate more passengers, and to save some portion of her income in preparation for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase motor tires and spare parts.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 26 years old, married to Mary. Together they have one child. His primary business is transportation, which he does through his motorcycle. He has been in the business for the past two years. He gets a monthly income of KES 7,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the whole amount to repair his motorbike and buy extra spare parts.

He will use the anticipated profits to invest back into his business. He hopes to grow his business and in future to own a fleet of vehicles. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Upesi Jiko Group

texts.en:
Joan is the facilitator of the Upesi Jiko group. Joan and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Joan takes care of 18 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund because of their prices and to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Joan had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joan was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acres of land.

With income from maize sales, Joan will educate her children, build a house and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Upesi Jiko group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Picture
In the photograph above, Joan is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Relita

texts.en:
Relita is 62 years old and lives in the village of Malibacsan in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is widowed with 11 grown children. 

To earn a living, Relita makes tasty snacks and sells them in the local community for a profit. Most often, she sells cassava cake, rice cake, suman, puto cheese, sweetened rice, etc. Those are native delicacies preferable to several Filipinos. She has been doing the job for two years and earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. Relita has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 5,000 to purchase additional snack items to vend.

Relita has been a member of the cooperative since 2008. This is her sixth loan request from GDMPC. In the future, Relita would like to rent a vending space, like at a school nearby, to have more sales. She hopes to receive successive orders in the future to sustain the business and her daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional snack items to vend.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is aged 26, married with one child aged 6 and works as a welder besides farming which he has been practicing for the last 4 years in his native home of Nkubu,Central Kenya. His farm produces maize, beans and eggs for the local market.

Andrew has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds for his poultry business.  He says the business will grow since poultry products have better returns and he has had experience too. He adds the income will enable him educate his child and uplift his family living standards in general.

He notes poor markets for farm produce and drought as the challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Liny

texts.en:
Liny is 44 years old and lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Liny owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. It is personally run by her husband. The vehicle has existed for over three years and allows the family to receive a monthly income of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 10,000, which will be used to renew the motorcycle and driving licenses to continue the business. 

Liny has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Liny hopes to buy one more vehicle for additional means of income and to be used in some other business deals if necessary. She expects to take another loan from the cooperative in the future to further improve her business engagement.

loans.use: To renew the motorcycle and driving licenses.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 29 years old married to Angela who is a student and they are blessed with one child six months old. Moses sells mobile phone accessories in Kitengela; Nairobi, where most of his clients are both female and male.

He has been in this business for the last one year and gets an income of KES. 10,000 monthly. He has applied for  a loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use KES.10,000 to purchase more mobile phone accessories,KES.10,000 calling cards and KES.10,000 purchase chargers for sale.

He will use the extra profit to pay fees and do masters.Moses hopes to own a cyber cafe. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more mobile accessories, calling cards and chargers.

loans.name: Allaoui

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and lives with wife and four children.

Allaoui is an owner of a home appliances store since 2008, selling electrical and mechanical machines like DVD players, clocks, telephones, washing machines, air conditioners, and microwave ovens. He has more than three years experience in this field and a good reputation. His store is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passed by.

He decided to apply for a $2100 loan in order to make a sliding door, digital Ads and to add more inventories to his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole

loans.use: to make a sliding door, digital Ads and to add more inventories to his shop.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad, a 39-year-old married mother of four school-aged children, lives in the village of Katipunan in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past 10 years, she has been growing a variety of root crops, shrubs, legumes and spices on fertile and rich cultivated land, selling them in the local market and interested neighborhoods.

A member of GDMPC for five years, Trinidad has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for land preparation costs. In the future, she hopes that the plants will continue to thrive and yield good financial returns. Trinidad plans to expand the cultivated area to earn more.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation costs.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is married with two children. She is 26 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental,  Philippines.

Liza is cultivating rich land, planting various types of vegetables, root-bearing plants, legumes, spices, outgrowth types, etc. She has been planting, harvesting and selling these crops for more than two years. This activity has allowed her to receive a total monthly income of 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 6,000 to purchase seeds and young raised crops to plant. 

Liza has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Liza hopes to have a good return on investment and plant more crop varieties in the next cycle of production. She plans to expand the tilled area for more gain.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and young raised crops to plant.

loans.name: Chumakhon

texts.ru: Чумахон житель района Пяндж. Возраст, 23 года. Холост. Имеет среднее образование. Его мать находится в Российской Федерации. Сам Чумахон занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Chumakhon lives in the Pyandj district.  He is 23 years old and single.  He has a secondary education.  His mother is in the Russian Federation.  Chumakhon is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for subsequent sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Tomato Group

texts.en:
Jamin is the facilitator of the Tomato group. Jamin and his fellow farmers rely on maize as their staple crop, which is typical for farmers in this part of Western Kenya.

Jamin takes care of four children at home with his wife.  He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jamin had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on two acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jamin was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on two acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jamin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Jamin will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Tomato group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 2 acres of maize.

Picture
In the photograph above, Jamin is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Domero

texts.en:
Domero is 55 years old and lives in Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Domero has engaged in a transport business activity. He owns and operates a motorcycle, which stands as the prime means of income for the family. He is driving around routine destinations very often and sending passengers to their designated point of destinations. He has had the business for three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. He has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 15,000 to repair the vehicle and continue his means of living as quickly as possible. 

Domero has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Domero hopes to expand and improve the business for a better living. He hopes to retain the business for long, long years.

loans.use: To repair the vehicle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old. She is a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling dried fish in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. She can also earn some income from selling onions and tomatoes.

Rose requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profits from this loan for paying the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 55 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a single mom of an only child. 

Clarita has a retail shop that sells mostly basic needs of the society. That includes canned goods, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, spices, salt, milk, sugar, soft drinks, juices and more. She has handled the store operations for 11 long years. This activity has allowed her to earn approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every month. She has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products to sell.

Clarita has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Clarita hopes to sustain the business much longer, and expand and improve product offerings to earn more.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Solana Group

texts.en:
Jackline is the facilitator of the Solana group. Jackline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Jackline takes care of seven children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to harvest more maize from her farm. In the recent 2011 season, Jackline had a very good maize yield, harvesting seven bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jackline was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acres of land

With income from maize sales, Jackline will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Solana group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1.5 acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Jackline is pictured with her group members and a few children of her co-group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 57-years-old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Peter owns and operates a used motorcycle business. The family's income comes primarily from motor repair charges. He runs a motor repair shop in the community, fixing various vehicle types to earn a living. He has been doing this job for four years and is earning PHP 3,000 a month, approximately. He has requested a loan from GDMPC worth PHP 15,000 to purchase motor spare parts. 

Peter has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Peter hopes to buy more tools needed in the business to improve service quality and expand product offerings.

loans.use: to purchase motor spare parts.

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab is an illiterate lady and performs her duties as a housewife very well. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband has an optical shop. He sells sun glasses through his shop. 

Zainab has given birth to 4 children. Her youngest daughter sews clothes while the others stay at home. Zainab is unable to provide education to her children due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy glasses in larger quantity and of different brands to put in his shop for selling. 

Zainab is hopeful that her husband’s business will be improved further and her family will be able to have a better financial life as a result. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zainab”.

loans.use: to buy sun glasses for optical shop business.

loans.name: Kristelle Lira

texts.en:
Kristelle Lira is married with one child to care for. Kristelle Lira is 25-years-old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living she sells personal products such as fashion jewelries, sun glasses, cellphone cases, and more. She loves fashion and new trends and that entices her to engage in such activity. She has been operating this site for two years and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to obtain more personal products to sell.

Kristelle Lira is a new member of the cooperative. In the future, Kristelle Lira hopes to be more progressive in this venture and would like to be able to widen the facility and product offerings to attract more customers. She plans to procure trendy items to meet the market's current demands.

loans.use: To obtain more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Nabuloli Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  Robin is the facilitator of the Nabuloli Tumaini group. Robin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Robin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Robin takes care of 10 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Robin had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Robin was only able to harvest 13 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Robin will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nabuloli Tumaini group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
In the photograph above, Robin is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a farmer and a resident of Nkubu, Central Kenya. She is aged 62 and has been in farming for 30 years producing and selling milk, passion fruits, coffee, eggs and bananas to the local market. She has 4 children all of whom are adults. 

Lilian has requested for a loan of 52,500 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional income will improve her living standard. She  aspires to have 8 dairy cows and increase the number of her poultry birds to 1000 in future.

Lilian says lack of sufficient animal feeds and diseases are the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married with nine grown children. She is 53-years-old and lives in Katipunana, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rosa loves to raise animals. She is engaged in the agricultural business sector raising livestock. While not the only source to generate income, the main source comes from selling cows. She has been feeding and taking care of animals for ten years and was able to have a favorable return in the past few years of trading. Rosa earns approximately PHP 2,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from GDMPC to buy calves to raise and sell for a profit in the future. 

Rosa has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Rosa hopes to raise them all successfully and be reimbursed. She hopes to have more to raise in the future.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise and sell for a profit.

loans.name: Gulsana's Group

texts.en:
Gulsana is the leader of this group. She is 31 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she brings up three sons; the older son is at school and the other two sons are preschool age (under seven). Three years ago with an initial investment of 600 soms, Gulsana purchased two farm animals and since that moment she has been engaged in livestock breeding. She applies for this loan because she needs money to purchase feed for livestock. In the future Gulsana wishes to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 51 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one grown child. 

Daisy owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Her vehicle has the capacity to carry 2-6 passengers, and she earns income for everyday expenses. Most of this type of vehicle can be found in rural and remote inclined areas. She had this business for three years. Each month, she receives a total income of 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to  purchase motor tires and spare parts. 

Daisy is a new member of GDMPC having initially borrowed the above mentioned amount of loan. In the future, Daisy hopes to expand and improve service offerings to gain more income for her family. She plans to own another vehicle in the future as additional means.

loans.use: To purchase motor tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is widowed with  two grown children. She is 49 years old and lives in Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she operates a food stall along the street on which many people are passing by. The more crowded the place, the higher is the possibility of sales. She sells checheria, food snacks, candies, fruit salads, and more. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns a total of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase additional products to sell.

Cecilia has been a member of GDMPC for four years. She took out several loans from the cooperative and was able to reimburse them promptly. In the future, Cecilia hopes to have a vehicle as another means of income and for extra undertakings when necessary. She further plans to expand and improve the business for more gain.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Segema

texts.en:
Segema is 28 years old and is married with two children, none of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling beans and sugar in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has had this business for five years.

Segema requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more beans, sugar, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Kosay

texts.en:
Kosay is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married and lives with his wife.

Kosay is a blacksmith. He opened his own shop in 2009. He sells and makes metal doors, windows and frames. He has good experience from his previous work with his father, and he has a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a generator and more materials for his work. He is aiming to increase profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and more materials for his work.

loans.name: Pinky Rose

texts.en:
Pinky Rose is 23 years old. She is married and has two little kids. The family settles for a living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Pinky Rose keeps herself busy raising pigs, a business she started two years ago. She makes sure that the pigs' shelter is clean every day and feeds them on time. The family has alternative means to generate income, but cash inflows are taken primarily from selling these pigs. Each month, she earns approximately 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 at GDMPC  to purchase feeding supplies for the piglets.

This is the first loan application made by Pinky Rose in the cooperative. She hopes that through this investment, she can provide necessary nourishment for the animals and sell them at a good cost in the future. She plans to expand the piggery and raise more.

loans.use: To purchase feeding supplies for piglets.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Nghĩa Group

texts.en:
Nghĩa is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong distict - Băc Ninh province.  Nghĩa is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu nhóm 03.

Nghĩa is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, Nghĩa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector making and selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling pork products in the local community. Nghĩa has had this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500,000 Viet Nam Dong (VND) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Nghĩa joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nghĩa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by this borrower from SEDA. Nghĩa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Mến is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock pigs.

2.  Quả  is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. She will use the loan to buy food for pigs and chickens.

3.  Ngọc is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock pigs.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Nghĩa là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong distict - Băc Ninh province.  Nghĩa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Hậu nhóm 03 (3).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nghĩa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nghĩa kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Nghĩa đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nghĩa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Mến là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.

2.  Quả  là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn và gà.

3.  Ngọc là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi lợn.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*L. ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Zipporah Wangari

texts.en:
Zipporah is a 36-year-old widowed mother of three children whose education she hopes to support to the university level. She operates a beauty salon in a residential area in Rongai, providing hair and beauty services to the local women. She says that this business is profitable, and the only major challenge she faces is power rationing. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Describing herself as very hardworking and honest, Zipporah will use her loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more hair relaxers, weaves and treatments to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to develop her business into a large and busy salon and boutique.

loans.use: to purchase hair relaxers, treatments, weaves and other hair additions.

loans.name: C 2187 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Florence, a 39-year-old married mother of five children between the ages of 9 and 18 years, owns a business selling goats and chickens. The leader of this group, which is called "Twitezimbere" in the local language, she is shown on the left in the photo.

Florence, who has been in her business for about two years, operates from 5 a.m. until 5 p.m. everyday, and has one employee. She and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their quantity of goats and chickens to sell. The extra profits accruing from the loan will be reinvested in their businesses and used to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, neither of whom are in school.  She makes and sells tea and has been in this business for four years.  Mary plans to use this loan from Kiva field partner BRAC South Sudan to buy more sugar for use in the tea she makes and sells.  If she realizes any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans to save it for a house she hopes to be able to build in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar for use in making tea

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase curtains to sell

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and lives with his wife and four children.

Haydar has owned an upholstery shop since 2004. He works in providing furniture, especially chairs, with padding, webbing, and fabric or leather covers. He has more than ten years experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of potential customers who pass by.

He decided to apply for a $2,700 loan in order to renovate his shop and to make two sliding doors. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to make two sliding doors.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and three daughters. 

Fatima and her husband work as school teachers with decent salaries. 

Fatima also has her own project, which is a grocery store. She wants to purchase more groceries to have a better collection for sale to increase her income. But the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Fatima gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase more groceries and have a better collection to enable her to compete and sell more. This will increase her income and enable her to provide better life conditions for the family. 

Fatima is photographed in the picture in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to have better collection for sale.

loans.name: Erdenechuluun

texts.en:
Erdenechuluun is 57 years old and lives with his daughter and wife in a house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He is from Hovd province. His daughter is a college junior and his wife stays at home. From 1973 to 1995, Erdenechuluun was a driver at the State transportation house and he has many years of work experience. Since 1995, he has been using his truck to manage a transportation business between Hovd, Uvs, and Bayan-Ulgii provinces. Erdenechuluun travels domestically once a month and earns 170,000 MNT daily. His monthly income is 910,000 MNT and his net profit is 50% of his income. Erdenechuluun mentions that his wife and daughter take care of life well when he is away. He is a hardworking, diligent, and honest man who says "My truck is the only source income for me and my family.  At least, I should maintain my truck in good condition." 

Erdenechuluun is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase five tires (each costs 400,000 MNT) and other spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: to purchase truck tires and spare parts

loans.name: Joseph Orudo

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old and married with a five month old son. He describes himself as hardworking and he provides very quick service to his customers. For the past year, Joseph has operated a poshomill service where he grinds and sells dried maize. His business is located near a quarry area. Joseph states that his biggest business challenge is insufficient capital to purchase stock. 

Joesph is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase more bags of dried maize. His business goal is to own another poshomill within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to purchase maize directly from the farmers, cutting out the intermediary.

loans.use: to purchase dried maize to grind

loans.name: Yakutai's Group

texts.en:
Yakutai is the leader of this group. She is 55 and, together with her husband, has raised two sons. Her older son is a dentist and her younger son works in Russia. Yakutai works as a bookkeeper. Eleven years ago, she got a bull-calf as a present from her dad and since then she has been breeding livestock. At the moment she keeps four sheep. 

Yakutai is requesting a loan to purchase livestock. In the future, with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she wants to purchase furniture and improve her family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Weyeta Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya!  

William is the facilitator of the Weyeta Group. William and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  Like the majority of farmers in Western Kenya, William and his co group members farm maize as a staple crop. 


William takes care of two children at home. In the recent 2011 season, William had an excellent maize yield harvesting 9 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  William was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.  Much of the improvement in yields comes from William's use of quality inputs via the One Acre Fund program, plus the farming training and group support that he receives as part of the One Acre Fund program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to William and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, William will primarily pay school fees for his children.  In 2012, the members of Weyeta group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
In the photograph above, William is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mama Umoja Group

texts.en:
Penina is the facilitator of the Mama Umoja group. Penina and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Penina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
