Penina takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Penina had a very good maize yield, harvesting 26 bags on 1½ acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Penina was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on 1½  acres of land.

With income from maize sales, Penina will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mama Umoja group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1.5 acres of land.

Picture

In the photograph above, Penina is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children.

Haydar has owned a shop since 2000, selling installation materials and electrical appliances. He obtained this business from his father, from whom he gained a good deal of experience. He is well known in his area, he has a lot of potential customers passing by, and he has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to make a sliding door and showcases and to buy additional inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to make a sliding door and a showcase and to buy additional inventories.

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.ru: Шамсулло более 9 лет занимается куплей и продажей сельхоз и мясомолочных продуктов. Он женат  имеет 3 детей у него на иждивении ещё двое. Шамсулло успешный предприниматель со стажем. Он раз в неделю покупает 2-4 голов рогатого скота и продает его в своей торговой точке. У Шамсулло есть сотрудник - помощник, который помогает ему на рынке. Шамсулло расширить бизнес и тем самым пополнить собственный капитал, для этого ему нужны средства. Шамсулло просит займ в размере 3000$ США, он надеется, что получит его и заранее благодарит за понимание.
texts.en: Shamsullo has been successfully involved in buying and selling agricultural crops, milk and meat products for over 9 years.  He is married, has two children and also support two more.  Shamsullo is a successful entrepreneur with experience.  He buys 2-4 heads of livestock once per week and sells it at his retail outlet.  Shamsullo has a co-worker, helper, who helps him at the market.  Shamsullo wants to expand his business and fill his own capital and needs sources for this.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 and hopes that he can obtain it and thanks you in advance for the understanding.

loans.use: to fill his own capital and expand his business

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her artificial jewelry business. With the loan, she will buy jewelry sets such as necklaces, earrings, rings and bangles, etc., in bulk quantity.  That will allow her to fulfill the clients' orders on time and earn more income. 
She started her business 2 years ago to financially support her husband, who sells clothes. 

She has given birth to 2 sons. Both of them are very young and are getting their education.  Robina is very confident that an investment will help her to improve her business and allow her family to live a better standard of life. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Robina”.

loans.use: To buy jewelry sets to sell

loans.name: Jirani Kwa Jirani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya, and the women of the Jirani kwa Jirani group!  Eddah is the facilitator of the Jirani kwa Jirani group, and she and her co-group members are currently enrolling in the 2012 One Acre Fund program.


Eddah takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Eddah had a really impressive harvest of 24 bags on 1.5 acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Eddah was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1.5  acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eddah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Eddah will educate her children and invest in livestock.

In 2012, the members of Jirani kwa Jirani group will each plant between ½ and 1.5 acres of maize.

Picture

In the photograph above, Eddah is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to boost his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beads.

loans.name: Emira

texts.en: Elmira is from the village of Arpeni in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married and has a high school education.  She considers herself a hard worker and has been engaged as a farmer for the past eleven years.  Elmira dreams of renovating her family home.  She would like a loan to purchase wheat seeds for the autumn planting season.  Elmira expects her income to increase by twenty-five percent with the investment.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance.  Elmira likes living near nature in Arpeni.  Also, most of her relatives live near her.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty isa  25 year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school.  She has a business of selling clothes in the Hai Mahad area in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan so that she can order more beautiful clothes for her customers.  She says that the profits from this loan will help her to pay for her child to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Isso

texts.ru: Иссо трудолюбивый, ответственный честный человек. Он женат, у него 4 детей, живет он со своей семьей.  Торгует на базаре  у станции  местного города .  Иссо  занимается куплей и продажей овощей и фруктов. Этим бизнесом он уже занимается два года и имеет накопленный опыт в этой сфере. Он приобретает товар на столичном базаре и  привозит на своей машине марки «Чанху» для продажи. Он хороший, заботливый  отец и хочет обеспечить детей для этого и чтобы расширить свой бизнес Иссо надеется  получить  займ в размере 1450$ США. Он  хотел бы получить эту сумму и расширить бизнес и этим обеспечить детям хорошее будущее.
texts.en: Isso is a hard-working, responsible and honest person.  He is married and has four children, and he lives together with his family.  He sells at the market by the local town train station.  Isso is involved in buying and selling vegetables and fruits.  He has been in this business for two years and has attained experience in this area.  Isso buys products at the capital city market and brings it in his "Chanhu" car for sale.  He is a good, caring father and wants to provide for his children.  To achieve this goal and to expand his business, Isso hopes to obtain a loan in the sum of $1450.  He wants to obtain this sum and expand his business, and, thus, provide his children with a good future.

loans.use: to buy products and expand his business

loans.name: Nabwoli Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Moses is the facilitator of the Nabwoli Mwangaza group. Moses and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Moses takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Moses was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 3/4 acres of land.

With income from maize sales, Moses will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nabwoli Mwangaza group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Picture

In the photograph above, Moses is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru: Аскару 57 лет, женат и имеет 3 детей.  Аскар долгое время работал учителем в школе и известен как принципиальный, честный и добросердечный человек.  Большой опыт и преданность своему делу позволили Аскару стать директором средней школы села Ой-Булак .   В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1991 году Аскар начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Стартовав с 18,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день его хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от бизнеса Аскар вложил в оплату за образование своих детей.   Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства,  Аскар обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на закупку скота. Доходы от кредита Аскар планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота и ремонта хозпостроек.
texts.en: Askar is 57 years old, married and has three children. Askar has worked as a school teacher for a long time and is known as an honest and kindhearted man. His experience and dedication has allowed Askar to become the director of the Oi-Bulak school. To supplement his family income Askar has also started a livestock raising and feeding business in 1991. He started his business with 18,000 som (KGS) and currently his business is making a profit of 15,000 som (KGS monthly. His business' profit Askar has allocated towards improving his children's education. To further improve and expand his livestock business, Aksar has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) which he will use to buy more cattle. Askar is planning to use the profit from the loan to further expand his herd and repair the barns.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 37-year-old man. He is married and has two sons and three daughters.

He is a lumber worker with a decent salary. Osama wants to improve the quality of his work by purchasing a new lumbering kit, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Osama gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay to purchase a new lumbering kit and will be enable to improve the quality of his work and work extra to increase his income and provide better life conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a new lumbering kit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, detergents, beverages etc

loans.name: Mama Safi Netundo Group

texts.en:
Simon is the facilitator of the Mama Safi Netundo group. Simon and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Simon takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and grow enough to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Simon had a maize yield of 22 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Simon was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Simon and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture packages, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Simon will invest in livestock rearing and save for future use.
In 2012, the members of Mama Safi Netundo group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph above, Simon is pictured with his group members, together with their field officer at the far left in the white t-shirt.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sinoko A Group

texts.en:
Justus is the facilitator of the Sinoko A group. Justus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Justus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
Justus takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate his children and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Justus had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Justus was only able to harvest four bags of maize on half an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Justus will invest in livestock rearing and educate his children.
In 2012, the members of Sinoko A group will each plant plots between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph above, Justus is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Iveta

texts.en: Iveta lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Isahakyan.  She is single and has a high school education.  She has been a private entrepreneur engaged in farming for the past twenty years.  Iveta also supports her brother’s son by taking care of his medical payments.  She is a very hard worker and enjoys the life of a farmer.  She dreams of saving enough money to support her nephew's university education.  Iveta would also like to enlarge her cattle shed.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds and some livestock.  According to Iveta’s business plan, this investment will increase her income by twenty percent.  She is pleased with microfinance, especially the well-organized disbursement process.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Bodrukhon

texts.ru: Бодрухон проживает в районе Пяндж. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Его дети учатся в школе, а его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам Бодрухон зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Bodrukhon lives in the Pyandj district.  He is 44 years old, married and has seven children.  His children attend a school, and his wife is involved in household work.  Bodrukhon earns a living by breeding cattle.  He breeds livestock at home.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Mohidilhon's Group

texts.en:
Mohidilhon is the treasurer of this group. She is 38 and married to a woodworker, who works in Russia. Each month her husband transfers 5000 soms to meet the family needs. Mohidilhon brings up a daughter and a son. The son is a woodworker too and the daughter studies at school. In order to earn additional money to live on, Mohidilhon cultivates cotton and wheat. Selling some part of the harvest, she earns an additional 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase fertilizers for cultivating wheat. In the near future she plans to purchase building materials for building a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 30 years old.  She is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in the school.  She has a business of selling food in a restaurant in Hai Mahad in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years.
Jennifer requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, with the hopes of expanding her business.  The extra income will be used for paying school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more maize flour for her restaurant operation.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is married and her husband is a salesman who sells different food items such as candies, biscuits, and chips to different general stores. He uses his bicycle to sell his products. Zarina is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighbors. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. Her earnings help her to pay utility bills. Zarina has four sons and two daughters. Four of her children are studying and getting an education from nearby schools.

Zarina is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy food items in bulk and improve his business. He has been operating his business for the past two years and Zarina hopes that this investment will help him sell more merchandise and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy food items in bulk

loans.name: Bitonge Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya! Anne is the facilitator of the Bitonge Mavuno group. Anne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Anne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
Anne takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and grow enough to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Anne had a very good maize yield harvesting four and a half bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Anne was only able to harvest two bags of maize on half an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Anne will invest in livestock rearing and save for future use. 
In 2012, the members of Bitonge Mavuno group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
In the photograph above, Anne is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 25 years old young man, he is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary. Mohammad will soon get married and he wants to make some repairs to the house he will live in with his wife such as: painting, windows, doors, etc; he will prepare his house well for this event, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of amount $2,000 from FATEN. When Mohammad gets the loan, he will pay with the amount he has to repair his house well preparing to his wedding, he will improve his house and live in better life conditions. Mohammad is photographed in the picture in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay for his wedding expenses.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 35-year-old married woman with five children; three of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling clothes in the Hai Mahad branch in Yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Charity requested this loan through BRAC South Audan to be able to purchase more clothes for sale. The extra income she earns will be used for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sabokhatkhon

texts.ru: Сабохатхон умная решительная  женщина. Она занимается куплей и продажей сельхозпродукции, в этом  бизнес она  уже 5 лет. Она торгует в основном картошку, лук и свеклу в центральном рынке. Сабохатхон мать 2 детей. Она хочет в дальнейшем расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Сабохатхон очень надеется, что сможет получить займ в размере 1680$ для расширения для расширения оборотного капитала и заранее благодарит  вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Sabokhatkhon is a smart and driven woman. She is a mother of two children. Sabokhatkhon has been selling vegetables for the last five years, mostly potatoes, onions and beets.  She purchases the produce from the farmers and then resells them at the central market. She would like to expand the size of her business and maximize profits. Sabokhatkhon hopes that she will be able to take out this loan of 1680 dollars to have a larger purchase capital for acquiring produce and would like to thank all her lenders in advance.

loans.use: to increase purchase capital

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime has been able to repay her first Kiva loan and her business has improved greatly. She also has been able to provide basic needs for her family and they are living a better life. 

Fatime is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to add merchandise to her food stall business to meet customer demand for wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is from the village of Haritch in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three daughters (ten, sixteen, and eighteen years old).  Anna has a secondary education and has been working as a farmer for fifteen years.  She also supports her relatives living in the cities of Gyumri and Artik with produce grown on her farm.  She is saving money for her youngest daughters to attend university.  She is also currently paying for her oldest daughter’s college education.  Anna dreams of renovating the family home.  She would like a loan to purchase wheat seeds and a calf.  She expects this investment to increase the family’s income by ten percent.  She is pleased with the services of microfinance and also likes the terms and conditions of the loans.  She enjoys her life in Haritch surrounded by her relatives and close friends.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and a calf

loans.name: Fareed

texts.en: Fareed is a 42 years man, he is a Palestinian National Authority employee with decent salary, he wants to make some repairs to his house such as: painting, tiles, doors and windows, etc in order to improve his living; but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of amount $2,000 from FATEN. When Fareed gets his FATEN loan, he will be able to pay for making repairs to his house and provide to himself better life conditions. Fareed is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for making repairs for his house to improve his living.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is a married woman with two children, one attends school while the other one is still young for school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a cereal selling business, supplying retail to schools and retail shop operators. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Rodah dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase eight sacks of beans to resell. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of beans to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 28 years-old.  She is a married woman with two children who are in school.

Rose has a business selling clothes in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years.  She can also earn some income from selling shoes.

Rose requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan in order to be able to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.  The extra income she will use to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bambanani Group

texts.en:
Fiona lives in Gweru, and is 30 years-old and unmarried. She has three children aged 12, 8 and 3 years-old.  The eldest two attend school.

Fiona rears and sells chickens.  The main constraint is lack of capital. She will use the money to poultry feed and young chicks.

She will use the proceeds of her investment to send her children to school and to expand the business.  In the long-term she wants to relocate her business to a more central location.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and chicks.

loans.name: Kulsara

texts.ru: Кулсаре 43 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей.   С 1992 года семья Кулсары успешно занимается животноводством и полеводством. При стартовом капитале в сумме 13,500 сом (KGS), Кульсара сумела увеличить хозяйство, насчитывающее 4 коровы, 2 бычка и  дающее на сегодняшний день прибыль в сумме около 7,000 сом в месяц.  Также, дополнительным источником  станет картофель, засеянный в этом году на площади в 1,20 га, который Кулсара планирует продать в мае – июле следующего года.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кульсара обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на постройку сарая со всеми необходимыми условиями для содержания скота.
texts.en: Kulsara is 43 years old, married and has four children. Kulsara's family has been farming and raising livestock since 1992. Starting with the sum of 13,500 som (KGS) Kulsara has been able to expand her herd, which now has four cows and two calves and yields a profit of 7,000 som monthly. An additional source of income this year will also be a three acre plot of potatoes of land which Kulsara is planning to sell in May/July of next year. To further develop her livestock business, Kulsara has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase four more calves for fattening and sale. Kulsara is planning to use the profits from the loan to build a new modern barn for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with three school going children, they live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, he has operated a tailoring business, making dresses and men's suits for sale. He operates from his shop whereby his potential customers are both men and women. Abdalla faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of establishing a tailoring school in the future. 

With the loan of Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase cloth for making men and ladies suits. He decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for making men and ladies suits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wood and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is 28 years old and is a married woman with four children who are in school.  She has a business of selling clothes in the Hai Mahad area in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years.

Cicilia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school.  The other one is too young for school. Her husband is a matatu driver and helps provide for the family's basic needs. Mariamu lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are house rent and business premises rent.

She has operated a vegetable and fruits stall for the past year.  Her customers are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where the demand is high during the end of the month. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase fruits and vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large number of pagnes to resell at a good profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 27 years old. She lives in Yerevan with her mother, as her father deceased and her brother lives in Russia. For the past nine years, Armine has been a trader. She rents a stall where she sells sport shoes, slippers, children footwear, and rucksacks. She buys merchandise from nearby countries once a month and resells it in her stall. Armine’s mother helps her as much as possible and thus they maintain their family. 

This is Armine’s second loan and she is requesting 2,500 USD to buy a large lot of slippers and children's autumn shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy slippers and children's shoes to sell

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.ru: Раънохон женщина - предпринимательница. Она занимается самостоятельно этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Раънохон  приобретает товар из других рынков города и продает на местном рынке. Она начала бизнес с малого количества женской обуви и постепенно расширяла поле  деятельности. У нее имеется своя торговая точка, где она занимается  бизнесом. Раънохон замужем имеет  2 детей, также у нее на иждивении два родителя. Она заботливая мать и жена, она старается улучшить условия жизни своей семьи, а для этого ей нужно расширить бизнес и получить прибыль. Раънохон для помощи обратилась к вам за помощью, ей нужно  получить займ в размере 1500$ США. Она надеется, что вы ей поможете  развить бизнес, путем предоставления займа и заранее благодарит за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Ranokhon is a female entrepreneur. She has been running her business independently for the last 10 years. Ranokhon purchases goods from central markets and sells them locally. She started her business from a small number of shoes she offered for sale and has slowly expanded her inventory. Now she has a market stall from which she runs her business. Ranokhon is married and has two children, and is also taking care of her elderly parents. She is a caring wife and mother and wants to improve her family's living condition. For this reason Ranokhon wants to expand her business and earn additional profit. She has turned to Kiva for help as she needs to take out a loan of 1500 US dollars. She is hoping that you will be able to help her improve her business by loaning money to her and she is grateful for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase goods and expand her business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 59-year-old man who is married and has one son and four daughters. His son and one of his daughters are employed with decent salaries. 

Mahmoud works as sweets distributor and he wants to purchase more sweets, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

When Mahmoud gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more sweets to distribute and increase his income in order to have better life conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more sweets to distribute and increase his income.

loans.name: Raider

texts.en:
Raider is 40 years old and a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling cassava and maize in Hai Mahad in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Raider requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more cassava, maize for sale. She will use the extra income to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and maize for sale.

loans.name: Johnson K.

texts.en: Johnson is 41-years-old and lives in Bardnersville. He is married and his wife is a business woman. They have two children ages 10 and 18 and all of them live at home and the children are presently in school. For the past five years he has been in the cement business. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cement for his business. He plans to send his children to a quality school and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cement for his business.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with three school-going children. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years she has operated a food stall business selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanatumu dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Huyên's Group

texts.en:
Huyên is a 41 year-old woman living in Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh province.  

Huyên is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is N. Xá nhóm 19 (19).

Huyên is married and has three school-age children. To making a living, Huyên owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising rabbits for sale. Huyên has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Huyên joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Huyên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and resell. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  

Huyên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Huệ is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her livestock business by buying food for pigs.

2. Quyết is a 23-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her livestock business by buying food for pigs .

3. Tỵ is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her livestock business by buying food for pigs and chickens.

4. Tính is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business raising chickens.

5. Cầu is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Huyên là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Huyên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là N. Xá nhóm 19 (19).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ nuôi thỏ để bán.  Huyên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Huyên kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Huyên đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Huyên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Huệ là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Quyết là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Tỵ là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Tính  là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Cầu là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Naranzul

texts.en:
Naranzul is 23 years old and lives with his parents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a very honest and hardworking taxi driver with his own car. Even though he has only three months of experience in the transportation sector, he is really improving and earning some money to meet his needs.

Naranzul has a girlfriend, and his short-term goal is to purchase some land and build a house on it to start a life with her. He believes in having his own comfortable house and living there with his family. Therefore he needs to have his own land. He is requesting a loan to purchase land in the suburbs to build his own new house.

loans.use: To purchase land in the suburbs to build his own house

loans.name: Mulinge

texts.en:
Mulinge is a widow with one child who has finished school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a beauty salon for the past three years.  Her clients are the local community residents. She faces a major challenge of a lack of customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs10,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for her salon. She decided to join Yehu because of easily accessed loans.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият трудолюбивая и умная девушка. Она занимается продажей потребительских  товаров для населения, это и  продукты питания и игрушки для детей. Хосият занимается этим бизнесом с отцом и братом. Она хочет расширить бизнес, увеличить товарооборот и максимизировать свой прибыль. Она запрашивает займ в размере 1048$ США. Хосият заранее благодарит вас за понимание
texts.en: Khosiyat is a hardworking and smart girl. She sells groceries and toys at the family's store, which she manages together with her father and brothers. She would like to expand her business, increase goods turnover and maximize profits. Khosiyat is requesting a loan of 1048 US dollars and would like to thank you all for support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan is by nature a very supportive lady. She is involved in the animal sales business. She buys animals from the animal market and sells to customers at a profit after raising them.  She does this work to support her husband financially. Her husband is a laborer by profession.  Rasoolan is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.  Rasoolan has 5 children. All of them have gotten their education up to the 5th standard and haven't been able to study further due to financial constraints. Two of them started working, and the others stay at home. 

Rasoolan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her animal business. With the loan, she will buy young goats and sell them at a good profit.  She started this business two years ago, and it is returning good profits. She is confident that an investment will be a profitable one for her. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rasoolan”.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal sales business

loans.name: Perrse

texts.en:
Perrse is a 34 year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in the school.  She has a business of selling dried fish in Hai Mahad in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for five years. She can also earn some income from selling alcohol, like beer, at home.
Perrse requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Taalaybek

texts.ru:
Таалайбек родом из села Тельман (Панфиловский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). Женат и воспитывает сына. 
Таалайбек родился в простой и многодетной семье фермера (8 детей), он был младшим сыном.  У отца было небольшое фермерское хозяйство и с детства Таалайбек, помогал отцу по уходу за скотом и мечтал в будущем иметь свое собственное хозяйство. 
После окончания школы Таалайбек пошел служить в армию в Сибирь. В 1985 году, отслужив 2 года в армии, Таалайбек вернулся в родное село и пошел учиться на водителя сельхоз техники, а затем устроился в местный колхоз в качестве тракториста - комбайнера. 
Спустя 2 года, в 1987 году Таалайбек женился. Женившись, Таалайбек с женой жили с родителями -  как принято у кыргызов, младший сын должен жить с родителями, и заботится об их здоровье. Постепенно, Таалайбек, работая в колхозе и получая зарплату, покупал молодняк и приумножал хозяйство. Год спустя родилась дочь. Таалайбек по-прежнему, работал в совхозе и параллельно вел хозяйство. В 1994 году умирает отец Таалайбека.
В 2004 году выходит замуж дочь Таалайбека(живущая со своей семьей отдельно), и в этом же году произошли еще два события в его жизни -умирает его мать и рождается сын. Все эти события значительно повлияли на его финансовое состояние. От колхоза Таалайбек получил участок земли 4 гектара, на которой он выращивает ячмень и клевер. Осенью 2010 года Таалайбек, продав двух дойных коров, закупил с полей сахарную свеклу и сдал ее на сахзавод. Такая сделка оказалась успешной и теперь, он планирует ежегодно скупать сахарную свеклу и продавать сахар во время подъема цен. Таким образом, Таалайбек пытается всеми путями прокормить свою семью и в данное время, благодаря  упорству и трудолюбию - дела у Таалайбека идут хорошо. В хозяйстве у него имеется 20 коров. Ранее были 5 голов бычков, которых он продал и купил автомобиль Фольксваген Гольф. Теперь, в свободное время он предоставляет населению услуги такси. 
 В целях дальнейшего развития своих бизнес инициатив, Таалайбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушу м и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на закуп сахарной свеклы. Сохранив запасы до весны, Таалайбек планирует продать свеклу подороже.  Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем - мечтает построить большой дом.
texts.en:
Taalaybek was born in the Telman village (Panfilov district, Chui region, Kyryzstan). He is married and is raising a son. 

Taalaybek was one of the eight children born to a simple farming family, he was the youngest son. His father was running a small farming business and as a child Taalaybek was helping him with livestock and dreaming about having his own herd in the future. After finishing high school Taalaybek served in the army in Siberia. In 1985, after serving two years, Taalaybek returned to his home village and started an apprenticeship to become a tractor driver, then took a job in the local kolhoz as a tractor-harverster driver. 

After two years, in 1987 Taalaybek married. After the wedding Taalaybek started living with his parents as is customary among the Kyrgyz, where the youngest son lives with his parents and takes care of their health. While working for the kolhoz and earning salary, Taalaybek was buying calves for his family's herd. After a year of marriage Taalaybek and his wife welcomed a daughter. Taalaybek was always working for the kolhoz and taking care of the family's farm in his spare time. In 1994 Taalaybek's father passed away. In 2004 Taalaybek's daughter got married and in the same year two more events happened - Taalaybeks' mother passed away and his wife gave birth to a son. All of these events had adversely affected the family's financial situation. From the kolhoz Taalaybek received 10 acres of land where he now grows oats and clover. 

In the fall of 2010 Taalaybek sold two of his dairy cows and used the money to purchase sugar beets and sell them to the sugar factory. This business turned out to be lucrative and in the future Taalyabek is planning to purchase sugar beets annually and sell them when the prices for beets increase. In this way, Taalaybek is doing his best to feed his family and currently, due to his dedication and hard work the family's well off financially. Taalaybeks' herd has 20 cows and he used to have five calves which he sold to purchase a VW Golf. Now, in his spare time he also offers taxi services in his village. In order to further expand his business initiatives, Taalaybek has turned to "Bai-Tushun and partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase more sugar beets. By storing the sugar beets until spring, when supply is low, Taalaybek is planning to sell the beets at a better price. Profits from the loan Taalaybek is planning to invest into purchasing more cattle and in the future he is hoping to build a bigger house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and lives with his wife and his two children.

Mahmoud has owned a furniture gallery since 2005, selling bedrooms, dining tables, sitting rooms and kitchens. He has more than six years experience in this field and a good reputation, and there are a lot of potential customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to purchase a Chinese furniture-making machine. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a Chinese furniture-making machine.

loans.name: Joe R.

texts.en: Joe is a single 28-year-old who lives in Bardnersville. He is a high-school graduate. He has a five-year-old child who is currently in school and lives at home. For the past four years, he has been involved in the cement business. He is requesting a loan to purchase more cement for his business. Joe plans to become a cement distributor and send his child to a quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more cement for his business

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is a married woman with one child who is too young for school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a cereal shop for the past two years. In addition, she also sales charcoal. Her clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of availability of stocks. She dreams of establishing a cereal wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stocks of maize, beans, sorghum, and millet for her business. She decided to join Yehu to gain easy access to loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of maize, beans, sorghum, and millet for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in the school. She has a business selling alcohol (beer) in the town of Hai Mahad, Yei county, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. 
Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beer for sale. She says that the extra income will help her to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya is a widow. Her husband died suddenly a few years ago. It was a very difficult time for Surriya but she never lost heart and worked very hard to raise her children. She is the mother of 3 sons, all of who left their education after 5th grade and started work to contribute financially to the family. 

She performed her duties as a seamstress and started getting orders from her neighbors. She made her neighbors become regular customers due to the good-quality work she produces. Now she receives regular orders every month which enables her to generate income for her family. 

She also has a buffalo whose milk she sells to her neighborhood clients and milk shops to earn extra profits. Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her milk-selling business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo that will allow her to get larger quantities of milk and increase her profits. She is hopeful that this investment will be more profitable for her.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Gereltuya

texts.en:
Gereltuya is a 40-year-old married mother of a 15-year-old son. She lives in her sister’s house with her son and cousin’s family. She is a pharmacist and loves her profession. Besides running a small pharmacy, she sells eyeglasses. 
Gereltuya is a very responsible person and her dream is to have her own home. Her husband works in Korea and her son attends a high school. During the last few years, the pharmacy business has not been growing much in the Mongolian market. Therefore she is planning to improve her eyeglasses business. The loan Gereltuya is taking will be used to purchase more eyeglasses to increase her stock.

loans.use: To purchase more eyeglasses to increase her stock.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a resident of Nkubu, Central Kenya, and has been in farming for the last 10 years. He is 27, married, and has two children, age 4 and 3 years. He currently employs three farmhands and produces maize, tobacco, beans, milk and groundnuts for the local markets.

Samuel has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes. He expects his production to improve significantly with the availability of water for the dairy animals and irrigation system. He adds that this will enable him to educate his children as well.

Samuel laments of the poor roads network and the insufficiency in animal feeds as the greatest limitations he faces.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Sukhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Sukhbaatar lives with his wife. His three children have already started their own individual lives. He has three years of experience in the taxi business. He used to drive his employer's car, but later realized that he could make more money driving his own car. In 2010, he bought a car to use for his own business.
He is a very hardworking and motivated husband who wishes for a better life for his family. He is requesting a loan to repair his car. It will help the quality of his taxi service and will increase his earnings in the future.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty is 36 years old and a married woman with two children. One of her children is in school. Jenty has a business selling beer in hai mahad branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Jenty has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to order more beer for sale. She says that the profits from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr: Madame Aby  est une femme mariée de 59 ans qui habite au Sénégal.  Elle est mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 15 et 41 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce. Depuis 10ans elle vendait du poisson. Mais actuellement elle commercialise de la pâte d’arachide. Elle a choisi cette activité car elle s’adapte mieux à cette dernière. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est la réalisation des bénéfices qu’elle génère. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2000. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 5 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pate d’arachide à revendre. Son objectif est de renforcer son fond de commerce et développer son activité de vente de pate d’arachide. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices elle souhaite améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Aby is a 59-year old married woman who lives in Senegal. She is mother to six children, whose ages range between 15 and 41 years old. She is making progress in the trading sector and for ten years she sold fish. Now, however, she is trading groundnut dough. She chose this business as she found it easier to adapt to. The money she makes is what interests her most. She has been a shareholder/member of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) since  February 2000 and has already had five loans. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs in order to buy groundnut dough for resale. Her aim is to strengthen her business and develop her groundnut dough selling activity. She would like to improve her family's social situation with the growth in her profits.

loans.use: to buy groundnut dough for resale

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a married man with one child who is too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman, operating a retail shop business which helps in supporting her family financially. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

He has worked as a driver for the past four years. His potential clients are the neighboring community members. He faces a major challenge of competition from other matatu (public motor vehicle) operators. He dreams of owning a tuk tuk (motorized rickshaw) in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his wife’s retail shop. He decided to join Yehu because of its low loan interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for his wife’s business.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 39-year-old woman who is married and has four sons and three daughters. Her husband is a worker with decent salary. 

Abeer wants to finish paying the university fees for two of her sons. She has money, but not enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN to add to what she has and pay. 

When Abeer gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay the university fees for her two sons. This will enable her sons to  complete their university degrees and improve their living standards and live with the family in better life conditions. Abeer is photographed in the picture in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for two of her sons.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to expand her husband’s candy business. He sells candies and chocolates to different general stores. 

With the loan, he will buy candies and chocolates in bulk to improve his sales and client base. 

Sajida has two sons and a daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school. 

Sajida is also involved in a sewing business. She learned this art from her mother before marriage and now she earns reasonably good profits from her skills. 

She is very confident that an investment will help her husband improve his business which will result in her family’s having a better financial life. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sajida.”

loans.use: To buy candies and chocolates to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old and a married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. Esther has a business selling bread in the hai mahad branch in yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Esther has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more bread for sale. She says that the profit from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for sale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with seven children who are all grown up. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house that has electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has owned real estate housesl for the past ten years. Her clients are the housing tenants. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing building materials. She dreams of building more real estate houses to rent out in the future.

With the Kshs 70,000 she wants to purchase construction materials to renovate her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu because of the variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man with three children who attend school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the family's basic needs. He lives in a rental house with electricity, but no running water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.  

He has operated a second-hand shop for the past year. He also practices farming. He faces a major challenge of seasonality where there is high demand at the end of the month. He dreams of making more profit in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase second-hand clothing for sale. He decided to join Yehu so that he can improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a widow. Mary has a business selling g_nut, maizes and cassava in the hai mahad branch of yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for nine years.

Mary has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more maize and cassava for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more g-nut, maize and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru:
Тамара родилась в 1957 г. в городе Капане. После окончания средней школы Тамара поступила в профессионально-техническое училище. 
Тамара вдова, вместе с ней проживают сын, невестка и двухлетняя внучка. Сын занимается строительно-ремонтными  работами, невестка работает на Капанском горно-обогатительном комбинате. 
С 1997 г. Тамара занимается торговлей одежды и обуви на Капанском городском рынке, где она арендует помещение. Тамара продает женскую, мужскую, детскую одежду, обувь и белье. Товары она приобретает раз в месяц в Ереване. 
Благодаря своему бизнесу Тамара помогает своему сыну и невестке содержать семью. Она очень любит свою работу и работает без выходных. 
Тамаре необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драм для приобретения женской, мужской и детской осенней одежды для своего бизнеса. 
Тамара получает кредит от организации Нор Оризон уже в третий раз и она всегда выплачивает кредит вовремя.
texts.en: Tamara was born in 1957, in the town of Kapan.  After graduating from a secondary school, Tamara went to a professional technical college.  Tamara is a widow.  Her son, daughter-in-law and a two-year-old granddaughter live with her.  Her son is involved in construction and repair work, and daughter-in-law works at the Kapan mining-enriching factory.  Since 1997, Tamara has been involved in sales of clothing and shoes at the Kapan city market, where she leases a space.  She sells women's, men's, children's clothing, shoes and undergarments.  She buys her merchandise once per month in Yerevan.  Thanks to her business, Tamara helps her son and daughter-in-law to support their family.  She loves her work very much and works without days off.  Tamara needs a loan in the sum of 500,000 dram for the purchase of women's, men's and children's fall clothing for her business.  This is Tamara's third loan from the Nor Horizon organization, and she has always repaid her loans on-time.

loans.use: to buy autumn clothing for her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with two children who attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past three years. Her customers are from her neighboring community. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loan products.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal, a 45-year-old lady, has decided to participate in people's happy moments like weddings, baby showers, and even public holidays and religious events, where everyone celebrates with their families.
Using her talent in decorating, Feryal started making baskets and trays that are used in these events. She decorates them per her customers’ requests using the materials and fabrics they want (some chose feathers, other silk and so on).
Feryal has applied for this loan to buy new types of fabric and accessories to have more options when decorating these baskets. She is hoping that one day she would be able to open her store to sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy new types of fabric and accessories to have more options when decorating baskets

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul has fully repaid his first Kiva loan and family living standards have improved. With the 20,000 KES he is requesting now, he wants to boost his wife's business by purchasing a blow dryer machine. Paul dreams of establishing a tailoring business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 33 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children.

Ali is an owner for mobile phone shop since 2006, repairing mobile phones and selling accessories and phones.  He has more than seven years experience in this field, and has a good reputation and he has a lot of customers passing by his shop.

He decided to apply for $2,400 loan in order to buy a computer, a generator and to make a showcases for his shop.  He is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to buy a computer, a generator and to make a showcases for his shop.

loans.name: Farhat Noreen's Group

texts.en:
A talented lady, Farhat Noreen operates a beauty salon at her home. She offers her customers makeup, facials and hair cutting services. Her customers are very satisfied with her work. They prefer getting services from her and avoid going anywhere else. 

She likes her profession very much and keeps herself updated about the latest trends.  

Besides her business, she also manages her household responsibilities efficiently. She takes care of her family and gives them the desired time. Her family respects her and loves her a lot due to her care for them. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her beauty salon business. With the loan, she will buy makeup items like mascara, eye shadows, lipstick and nail polishes, etc., and beauty products such as face creams and masks for her salon to produce better quality work and get good income.
 
She is confident that she will take her business to a more profitable position with the loan investment and improve the lifestyle of her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farhat Noreen.

loans.use: To buy makeup items and beauty products for the beauty salon business.

loans.name: Toto

texts.en:
Toto is a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of a lack of fish due to seasonality, especially during the dry, hot season. She dreams of her business in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase more kilos of fish for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of its loan efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase more kilos of fish for her business.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a 33-year-old lady who is married to Ali, a truck driver. She has been working from her house in flower arranging to help her husband in improving their living level.

Now Reham has applied for this loan to start another business besides what she does, which is selling home products such as kitchen tools (plates, pans, etc), and expand her current business among Madaba, where she lives.

Because Reham is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband Ali appear in the photo.

loans.use: To start a retail business selling home products such as kitchen tools

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 27-year-old married lady who is helping her husband in supporting their family of six members by selling dresses.

She has applied for a loan in order to start looking for a store where she can start her retail business in a professional way.

loans.use: to start looking for a store where she can start her retail business in a professional way.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce has been able to repay her loan ahead of schedule and she is taking up another Kiva loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to increase her inventory. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of cereals, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding her business in the future to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cereals, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 30 years old. She is a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has a business of selling sugar and soda in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more soda for sale. She says that with the extra income from this loan, she will pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and soda for sale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema has been able to repay her first Kiva loan fully and she is taking out a bigger loan of 40,000 KES. With the loan, she intends to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and beans for her food stall business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with one child who is too young for school. His wife is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

He has operated a tailoring business for the past year; he also practices farming. His potential clients are anyone who needs his services. He faces a major challenge of seasonality as the demand is high during the end of the month. He dreams of making more profit from his business.

With the 35,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase a zigzag sewing machine, threads, lining and zips. He decided to join Yehu because it eradicates poverty in rural areas.

loans.use: To purchase a zigzag sewing machine, threads, lining and zips.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 50 years old, married; he lives with his wife and his four children.

Anwar is an owner of a furniture gallery since 1995, selling bedrooms, dining tables, sitting rooms and kitchens.  He has more than six years of experience in this field and has a good reputation and there are a lot of customers passing by his shop. 

He is requesting a $2,500 loan in order to enlarge his gallery by renting the shop next door to him.  He is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to enlarge his gallery by renting the shop next door to him.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman with six school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Kache lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Kache has been operating a fish selling business for the past four years. Her potential customers are the local community members. She faces a major challenge in the rising prices of fish and their scarcity during dry hot season. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000,  Kache wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of loans giving.

loans.use: buy fish to resell

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is a married woman with six children who are all grown up. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Leila has been operating a food stall for the past three years.  In addition, she also sales charcoal. Her potential clients are the neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge in transporting charcoal. She dreams of expanding both her businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, Leila wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to be able to expand her businesses.

loans.use: purchase charcoal

loans.name: Safari

texts.en: Safari has successfully completed his first Kiva loan and is currently requesting for a bigger loan of 40,000 KES.  He wants to open a vegetable stall. He dreams of having a vegetable wholesale shop one day. With the new loan amount,  Safari wants to purchase vegetables for his new business.

loans.use: buy vegetables for his new business

loans.name: Sadia's Group

texts.en:
Sadia is married and her husband is involved in selling paper envelopes. He supplies the paper envelopes to different stationery shops and other individuals who retail sell this item. He fulfills their orders to earn profit for the family. 

Sadia herself is a housewife.  She stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 5 children, all of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education except the youngest one, who is only 3 years old and is not of school-going age yet. 

Sadia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy paper envelopes in bulk quantity to increase his sales and profits.  Sadia is very confident that her husband will be able to make more profits from his business after the loan investment.

loans.use: buy envelopes in bulk to resell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 42 years old, married.  He lives with his wife and five children.

Ali is a blacksmith; he opened his own shop in 2009.  He sells and makes metal doors, windows and frames.  He has a good experience from his previous work, and has a good reputation.  He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to renovate his shop and to pay the annual rent.  He is aiming to increase profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to renovate his shop and to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Mme Safiatou est mariée et mère de 01 enfant. Il a 15ans et va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des céréales et des légumes depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne à TITAO et LEO des villages environnant. Ses clients sont les consommateurs (femmes et hommes) et aussi les revendeurs.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sachets d’ail et 10 sacs de maïs.

Mme épargne ses économies pour construire. Elle ambitionne avoir un grand magasin pour stocker les marchandises et revendre en temps opportun..
texts.en: Safiatou is married and has one child who is 15 and goes to school. She has 3 dependents in all, and has been selling cereals and vegetables for the past 6 years. She gets her supplies in the nearby towns of Titao and Léo and sells her products to both consumers and retailers. She will use the loan to buy 2 bags of garlic and 10 sacs of corn for resale. Safiatou is building up her savings so that she can construct a large warehouse where she can store her merchandise and resell it when the market conditions are most favourable.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of garlic and 10 sacs of corn.

loans.name: Maytham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and five children.

Maytham has been the owner of a food market since 2009.  He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs.  His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by his shop. 

He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate his market and to add more foodstuffs.  He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Маленькая дочь Анны попала в больницу. На лечение ушло много денег, которые Анна брала из бизнеса. Теперь ей нужен кредит, чтобы пополнить товарные запасы. Анна хочет купить сезонную джинсовую одежду, как мужскую, так и женскую. 

Предыдущий кредит помог Анне увеличить товарооборот и получить дополнительную прибыль. Анна взяла наемного работника, который торгует 2 дня в неделю. Т.о. у Анны появилось больше времени, чтобы проводить с малеькой дочерью. Анна по-прежнему хочет открыть в магазине отдел по торговле одеждой, но возможно она сделает это с помощью следующего кредита.
texts.en: Anna's small daughter ended up in a hospital.  Anna spent a lot of money, taken from the business, on her treatment.  Now she needs a loan in order to increase her merchandise inventory.  Anna wants to buy seasonal men's and women's jean clothing.  Anna's previous loan helped her to increase her goods turnover and make an additional profit.  She hired a worker, who sells twice per week, and now Anna has more time to spend with her small daughter.  Anna still wants to open a clothing sales department at a store, but will likely do this with the help of her next loan.

loans.use: to expand an assortment of warm jean clothing

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  She is 53 years old, a widow and she lives with her child.

Halima has been a tailor since 1990; she makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, such as suits, coats and trousers for women and kids.  She has good experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs.  She has a good reputation and she is well known in her surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $3,000 to purchase two industrial sewing machines, a generator and to add more materials such as buttons, zippers, and thread. She is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase two industrial sewing machines, a generator and to add more materials as buttons, zippers, and thread.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina, 39, is married and has 2 sons and 1 daughter. They live in Wehdat, where her husband works as truck driver.

Fatina is a well-spoken and intelligent lady who has a lot of experience in the trading field. She started a small business at home selling electronics such as vacuum cleaners, stereos, etc.  Now Fatina has applied for this loan to bring in more products to sell so she can help her husband in raising the family’s income.

loans.use: buy electronic products
