loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn has successfully completed her first Kiva loan and wants a bigger loan of KSH 80,000 to expand her wholesale business. She dreams of establishing another wholesale shop in the future. With the new loan amount, she want to purchase bed sheets, buckets and other stock for her business.

loans.use: purchase bed sheets, buckets and other stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy flour, sugar, butter, oil and baking powder

loans.name: Farukh

texts.ru: Фарух работает таксистом уже два года, в день он обслуживает  более 100-120 пассажиров. Он ответственный, старательный стремится всегда продвигаться вперед в своем деле. Фарух старается создавать комфорт в автомобиле,  для своих клиентов, поэтому старается тщательно проводить осмотр запчастей машины. У  Фаруха  на иждивении более 7 человек. Он хочет развить свой бизнес  путем покупки запчастей машины в случаи  внезапных  неполадок быстро отремонтировать и обслуживать большее количество клиентов- пассажиров.
texts.en: Farukh has been working as a taxi driver for two years and serves over 100-120 passengers per day.  He is responsible and diligent, and always strives to move ahead in his business.  Farukh tries to provide comfort for his clients in his vehicle, and this is why he tries to thoroughly inspect his vehicle parts.  Farukh supports over seven people.  He wants to develop his business by buying spare parts for his vehicle to ensure against emergency breakdowns that can be repaired quickly and service continued to more customers-passengers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old.   She has five children,  all of whom are in the school. She is a widow.  

Mary has a business selling onions and tomatoes in Hai Mahad town in Yei,  South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.  Mary requested this loan through BRAC in South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business.

loans.use: buy onions and tomatoes

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes in providing for the family's basic needs.  Mejumaa has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mejumaa has been operating a cafe for the past year.  Her potential clients are the neighboring community members. She faces a major challenge in unpaid debts from her customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan for KSH 40,000,  Mejumaa wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans for her business.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Delwendekonkilye Group

texts.fr:
Mme Sophie est la représentante du groupe DELWENDEKONKILYE. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans le moins âgé a 12ans.04 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend une boutique et des légumes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionnement dans un magasin à larlé en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, enfants et les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 10 bidons d’huile de 5 litre, 05 cartons spaghetti, 01 sac de choux et 01 sac d’aubergines.

Mme économise pour agrandir sa boutique. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, s’occuper de ses parents devenus vieux et aussi ouvrir d’autre point de vente.
texts.en:
Sophie is the DELWENDEKONKILYE group´s representative. She is married and the mother of 4 children aged between 12 and 15 years, all of whom attend school. She has 5 dependents in all and has been selling food and vegetables from her own shop for the past 10 years. She gets her supplies in the town of Larlé and sells her products to all types of people. She will use the loan to buy 10 5-liter cans of oil, 5 boxes of spaghetti, 1 sac of cauliflower and 1 sac of aubergines.

Sophie is building up her savings so that she can enlarge her store. She would also like to be able to cover her children´s educational expenses, support her aged parents and eventually open another store.

loans.use: to buy 10 5-liter cans of oil, 5 boxes of spaghetti, 1 sac of cauliflower and 1 sac of aubergines.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 38-year-old married man and is a father of three children. He has worked in transportation for 15 years.  

George started transporting raw materials to a very important cement company in 2009.   This contract helped a lot in improving his family's social and financial situation, because it helped in improving his income.

His truck is very important to his business -- it is his only means to earn a living.  That's why he has to keep it in good condition.  To do so, George has  requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner to do necessary maintenance for his truck.  He also intends to pay for his children school fees with part of the loan.

This is George's first experience with Al Majmoua.  He hopes that this will lead to future investments good enough to make his business into a big transportation company.

loans.use: do needed maintenance for his truck

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a married man with one school-going child. His wife is a cook who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He has a house with electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees his child. 

He has operated a café for the past one year; in addition to this, he is also employed. His potential clients are the local community members. He faces a major challenge of transportation of food from the market to his cafe. He dreams of establishing a hotel shop in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase seats and foodstuff for his café. He decided to join Yehu because of the good loan products.

loans.use: To purchase seats and foodstuff for his café.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, single, and lives with five family members, one of whom works.

Since 2009, Iyad has owned a shop where he has a photocopier and sells stationery. He has a lot of experience and a good reputation, and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a loan of $1,800 in order to purchase a new photocopier machine. He aims to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a new photocopier machine

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 49 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her two children.

Haifa has been a tailor since 1980. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, including suits, coats, and trousers for women and kids. She has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation, and she is well known in surrounding areas.

She is requesting $2,400 to purchase two industrial sewing machines and a generator, and to stock more materials such as buttons, zippers, and thread. She aims to gain more profits so she can provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two industrial sewing machines, a generator, and to stock more materials such as buttons, zippers, and thread

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 28 years old with two children, none of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business of selling sugar, soda and beer in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, soda and beer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lapper (traditional cloth) and slippers for her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 23-year-old single man from Ramallah.  He wants this loan to be able to open a store that provides people with everything from internet access to a PlayStation and billiards, and even has a small cafeteria.  Since he will start this business, he will need to buy all of these things in order to complete his store.  He hopes that this loan will make his dream become a reality, and will be able to own a store of his own.

loans.use: buy everything for his store (PlayStation, billiards, food, furniture)

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and a father of three children.

Farhat has been an owner of a fabric shop since 2008, selling a selection of fabrics such as wool, linen, silk, cotton and bridal fabrics. He has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of the local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2500 loan in order to redecorate his shop and to purchase a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop and to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a widow and has a 19-year-old daughter. She is a small entrepreneur from Berdyansk, where she runs a water filter sales business in one of the local malls. She started this business one year ago. Her current working capital is 20,000 Grivnyas and her profit is 5,500 Grivnyas.

Natalya is a competent businesswoman, which has helped her gain the trust of her customers. Water filters sell well in Berdyansk as running water is polluted and needs additional purification. Natalya enjoys working with this type of merchandise and is hoping to continue expanding her business in the future.

Natalya is requesting a loan for 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted merchandise for further retail sale. She is hoping to generate additional profit and invest it in the reconstruction of her small selling facility.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of water filters for sale.

loans.name: Kichuna

texts.en:
Kichuna is a single woman with no children. She lives in a family house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is her personal maintenance. 

Kichuna is currently a teacher but with this loan she wants to start a charcoal selling business. She faces a major challenge of enough income to sustain her basic needs. She dreams of establishing her own business and not depend fully on her teaching job.

Kichuna is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of charcoal to start her charcoal business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to start her charcoal business.

loans.name: Opani

texts.en:
Opani is 26 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. She has a business of selling onions and tomatoes in Hai Mahad, Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Opani is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase more onions and tomatoes for sale. The profits from this loan will help Opani pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer for fish storage.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 41 year old single lady who loves nature. She became a florist and opened her own store in Wehdat 7 years ago.

During these 7 years she has added another section to her store that sells decoration accessories. She has gained a lot of good feedback from the customers. Now Basma has applied for this loan to add more types of plants and flowers to what she sells.

loans.use: to add more types of plants and flowers to what she currently sells.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two school going children. Her husband is employed and contributes his salary for the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees her children. 

She has operated a cafe for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating food prices. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase flour, sugar, cereals, salt, water, cooking oil and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu because of efficient loan products.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cereals, salt, water, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials such as wood, paints, and brushes.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 40-year-old married man, father of two children. He works as a barber, and opened his own shop in 2007. Mohamad is a hardworking man. He seeks perfection in his business and for his family. 

Mohamad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary products for his business. These products are frequently requested by his customers, whom he believes he has to keep satisfied all the time. Mohamad will also pay for his children's school fees, since educating them is very important to him. Mohamad is liked by most of his customers. Most of his customers are his friends, neighbors and relatives. They enjoy visiting him more often, and he enjoys their visits too.

loans.use: to buy necessary products for his business.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado por 15 Señoras muy trabajadoras que se unieron para formar un grupo; un comité solidario apoyado por la Fundación Paraguaya, actualmente están en el noveno ciclo, en donD. el compromiso es en conjunto y la clave del éxito poseer un espíritu emprendedor. Las mismas residen en la ciudad D. Caaguazú,  están muy entusiasmadas D. seguir progresando y creciendo cada día más.
La señora Hilaria se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. todo tipo. Comenta que esto lo realiza hace ya un tiempo, por lo cual tiene ya una clientela bien definida. Este ha sido su medio D. vida y la D. su familia, gracias a su trabajo pueD. obtener los medios necesarios para mantener su hogar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. ropas, como ser pantalones, remeras y camisas para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 15 very hardworking women who joined together to form a group – a communal bank supported by Fundación Paraguaya.  They are currently in the ninth cycle where they are committed as a group and the key to their success is possessing an enterprising spirit.  They all live in the city of Caaguazú and are very excited about continuing making progress and growing more each day.

Hilaria sells all sorts of clothing.  She comments that she’s been doing this for some time now so she has a well-defined clientele.  This has been her and her family’s source of support and thanks to her work she’s been able to earn the necessary resources to support her household.

She requests the loan to buy clothes like pants, t-shirts and shirts for subsequent resale.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts and shirts for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline has successfully completed her first Kiva loan, and now she wants another one of KES 30,000. With this amount, she wishes to expand her business.  She wants to purchase embroidery materials and kitenge for her business.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials and kitenge for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients (corn, rice, pork cracklings, beans, cheese, salt and tomatoes).

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira, leader du groupe d’affaire «Ahadi», est  entrepreneur, âgée de 43  ans, mariée, mère de plusieurs  enfants et petits fils et filles. Son mari est un mécanicien. Elle est  vendeuse de bananes (plantains). Elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre depuis sa jeunesse. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 9 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 régimes de bananes et réaliser d’autres micros projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et scolariser ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Kavira is the leader of the "Ahadi" business group. She is a 43-year-old entrepreneur and the mother and grandmother of several boys and girls. Her husband is a mechanic and she has been in sales since she was a young girl. She currently sells bananas (plantains). She got her initial capital from her husband and has already completed 9 loan cycles with Hekima. She will use this new loan to buy 15 bunches of plantains and realize some small family projects. Kavira also hopes to be able to cover her children´s educational expenses and watch them grow up comfortably. She would like to thank Hekima for helping disadvantaged women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 15 bunches of plantains for resale and realize some small family projects.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel D. 57 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su hija y su compañero D. vida Miguel D. 63 años edad el cual es jornalero. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. ricas tortillas. Tiene 9 años D. dedicarse a esta actividad  y gracias a Dios  y a su trabajo ha sabido mantener el negocio activo.  María es muy conocida en la zona y muchas personas confían en ella ya que es una mujer  responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su hogar D. residencia el cual está en una zona bastante segura y muy transitada por muchas personas. A pesar D. su edad no se da por vencida, tiene muchas energías y para élla el trabajo es vida. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el negocio en la compra D. insumos como: maíz, leña, agua y cal. con el fin D. ofertar una mayor cantidad D. tortillas y poder cubrir una mayor demanda. Espera poder tener resultados positivos y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María Isabel, 57, lives in her own house with her daughter and common-law husband, Miguel, who is 63 and works as a wage-earner.  She makes and sells delicious tortillas, which she has been doing for nine years.  Thank God, and through her hard work, she has been able to keep her business active.

María is well-known in the area and many people trust her as a responsible, hard-working woman and they think of her mainly as an entrepreneur.  Her business is set up in her home which is in a safe area with many passersby.  Despite her age, she does not give up and has a lot of energy to keep on working, which she feels is vital.  She has decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL to invest in her business.  She plans to buy supplies such as corn, firewood, water and lime so she can increase production and meet demand.  She hopes to obtain positive results and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as corn, firewood, water and lime.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en: Husam is a 29-year-old single man from Gaza.  He is hoping that throughout this loan he will be able to start running his own business, which is a clothing store. He hopes that he will be able to buy stands and goods for the store. This will increase his income and bring in customers, too.

loans.use: to purchase stands and goods for the store

loans.name: Jorlus

texts.en:
Jorlus is 45 years old and has five children, two of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business of selling bananas and tomatoes in Hai Mahad branch in Yei South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Jorlus requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. With the extra income, she will pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Tunje

texts.en:
Tunje is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent. 

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past one year; her potential clients are neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are low sales during the rainy seasons. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase vegetables such as potatoes for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as potatoes for her business.

loans.name: A.c

texts.en: A.C. is 49 years old, and lives in Airport Community. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have six children between the ages of 9 and 36 years old; three are currently in school and live at home, while the others are living on their own. For the past twenty-five years, she has been selling bread. She makes good profit because she has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and butter for her business. Her plan is to build a bakery, and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, and butter for her business

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a widowed woman with five children, two of whom attend school, while the other three dropped out. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past three years; her potential clients are the local community members. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where demand is low during the rainy seasons. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase charcoal for her new charcoal business. She decided to join Yehu because it empowers women.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for her new charcoal business.

loans.name: Rina Patricia

texts.es: Rina Patricia de 39 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con su hijo de 14 años de edad el cual se encuentra estudiando. Ella tiene a  su esposo y otro hijo en Estado  Unidos los cuales de vez en cuando mandan un poquito de dinero para que pueda ir sobreviviendo, pero este ingreso que recibe no es fijo ya que su esposo no posee un empleo formal en dicho país y solamente manda remesas cuando puede.  Rina no es una mujer que se sienta a esperar. Hace tres años decidió poner una pequeña tiendita gracias al aporte económico de su esposo, en la cual comercializa diversidad de productos de primera necesidad. Es muy conocida en la zona ya que ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer amable, luchadora y servicial. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para hacer crecer su negocio e invertir en la compra de variedad de productos como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, bebidas, sal, golosinas, pan dulce y de más productos de tienda que permitan atraer a mas clientes. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta manera podrá salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Rina Patricia is 39 years old and lives in the family home with her son aged 14 who is studying. She has a husband and another son in the United States who occasionally send a little money so that they can carry on surviving. However, this is not a fixed income as her husband does not have permanent employ in the States and only sends remittances when he can. Rina is not a woman who sits and waits. Three years ago she decided to open a small shop thanks to her husband's economic contributions. Here she sells a variety of staple products. She is very well known in the area as she is a kind, enterprising and helpful woman. She has taken the decision to ask INTEGRAL for a loan in order to grow her business and invest in the purchase of a variety of products such as: sugar, rice, beans, beverages, salt, sweets, pastries and other such products that will attract more customers. She trusts in 'Dios todo poderoso' (God the almighty) to get ahead in this way and improve her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as: sugar, beverages, rice, beans, salt, sweets, pastries etc.
